Bei seiner Vollendung, gewinnt der Erbauer das Spiel.

TEXT.English: Against the Grey
TEXT.German: Vernichtet die Grey

TEXT.English: Description: Decius takes his battle to the Sidar.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Wages of Sin scenario.

After the third group of hunters went missing, Decius started to get upset. The trip south from the lands that he had conquered around Tempus Mor was rife with danger, as mountain passes ended in steep drops as often as not, and even the gentle slopes led down into mist-filled valleys with treacherous bogs and swamplands. They were easy prey at night; even the Nightwatch would often be found slain in the morning. He began to wish that his whole group had taken the sea route again, but he hadn't wanted to risk Overcouncil or Sidar forces coming in from the north and pinching them against the main Sidar army.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Even the Svartalfar hunters who guided them, experts at avoiding detection, would find some among their numbers poached.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then one morning they awoke to find a whole company of bloodpets dead. Decius ground his teeth as the bit of sun that came through the thick clouds illuminated the grisly scene.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Commander, may we speak?" The voice came from above as the speaker slowly descended. A succubus, sent with word of Os-Gabella's offer and to assist Decius. It was less an offer and more a plea; were he to return with the blade that slew Ethne of the Elohim, he could name his price from the old sorceress. It was too tempting of an offer for him to pass up, not to mention the value he would get from using these Sidar as his personal spies should he subdue them. But just finding them was proving a most difficult quest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, what is it?" Decius averted his eyes from her shapely, and nude, form, not out of modesty but because he didn't want to be reminded at the moment of another woman whose company he had recently kept, the druid Talia Gosam.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You are a wise commander, but you are still blind to some of the options that are open to you. Why do you grieve the loss of these troops?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm not in the mood for games, creature. What is your suggestion?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"They did not serve you willingly in life; why let them take to death against your wishes? We can animate these bodies, and send them ahead. Let the Sidar ghosts strike with their poisoned blades against hearts no longer beating."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, we'll make them strike twice for every kill."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Furthermore, their assassins have been aiming for our scouts and workers, or other weaker troops. Let us petition Esus to deceive their eyes. For Agares to grant us allies more at home in the darkness than our foes are. To Aeron, for strength to fight frenzied even when poisoned and dying. And most importantly, to Ceridwen, for the secret knowledge the great seer holds."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I don't like seeking the help of gods. They usually take more than they give."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Our gods will not collect on their debt for some time Decius. Their goals align with yours, and they do not seek to pull your strings, as you already follow their path. Their price is cheaper than losing your head to an assassin's blade."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius stared at the demon for a moment. "Very well. What is needed?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The ritual was prepared. Decius's blood was spilled into the fires, and he recited the prayers. In the dancing flames, the valley was illuminated, showing the path to take to the enemy's gates."

The Elohim sent a guide to lead the Malakim to the Astur wastes, and the Ljosalfar lent a skilled elven tracker. The assassin Decius captured was bound and marched at the head of the column.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Still the winding paths claimed many as they traveled in pursuit of the hidden civilization of the Sidar. Mountain passes dropped into valleys cloaked in fog, filled with swamps and ruins. Even when not on the move, men disappeared at night, until a full score of Lightbringers were posted guard each sundown. Even so, the Sidar captive was taken back by his allies one night, out from under the Malakim guards. The next day Decius marched the Malakim forces harder, keeping scouting parties roving constantly around the main force but never out of sight of one another. And still nearly a third of his forces were cut off navigating a swampy valley in the dense fog, lost from the rest of the company. When Decius found out, he ordered his army to stop and set up camp at the nearest hilltop, deciding that it was time to try something new.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Greetings, lord," the Vicar said as Decius entered the tent used as temple. "Have you orders?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. I would like to pray." The Vicar nodded, lighting incense and beginning the recitation of Lugus's noontime prayer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I meant alone." Decius waited while the Vicar left. Decius stood, then knelt, then finally sat near the altar, arms crossed and staring into the brazier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This was a holy place, but Decius felt no special kinship to Lugus, despite his friend's devotion. Junil and justice he had been taught to revere, but Decius had betrayed Junil's chosen people. Who should he turn to? Sirona, Ethne's patron? Sucellus, God of Life? Or... who? His theological knowledge didn't extend very deep, and shortly gave up trying to decide the best recipient of his pleas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Oh gods who love justice and oppose the spreading darkness, hear me. I have failed you in the past, sometimes greatly. I have been rash and selfish, and am not a disciple of your ways. But you have failed me as well, or least your followers and laws have. Do not let my people die in this valley of death. A good woman's soul is doomed if we fail. And if the Calabim and their allies manage to subdue these Sidar ghosts, they stand to turn the tide of the war we've almost won. Surely the end of the world should draw your attention? Surely opposing this grave evil merits your favor? I am an imperfect champion, but do not let these good people suffer for my impurity. Show me the way, and I yield my will to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius waited briefly for a sign. Then sighed and left the tent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The fog had lifted from the valley, and the clouds above had parted. The way was made clear. Hunters' hawks took flight. Soon they learned that they were not far from the enemy's borders, and the treacherous passage would be safer in this clear day.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Should we continue the march?" asked one of his commanders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Not yet. Set up a permanent encampment here. This hill is the place of our deliverance, from where we will prepare to take the Sidar capital and their warriors as our vassals."

"This is but a room," the voice said, "And your entrance here means nothing. We will leave this place and find another."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This isn't the first of your cities that have been conquered, shade. I will not give up until you yield. The world is not as big as it once was, when it emerged from winter wild and open. Places to hide are running out."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon appeared behind him. "What do you want, Decius? A Sidar assassin to strike against your father in Torrolerial? He has his hands full with the Doviello invasion, I think. We could slay Varn Gosam in his sleep, if you still despise him, or free you from your obligations to Flauros while he feeds."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You know so much about me? I think it is time for you to start answering my questions."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Giving answers isn't what we do. We watch and plan and wait and, if absolutely necessary, we act, without the world knowing we were here. To preserve the Sidar and our seclusion." Sandalphon faded from view again. Decius turned to Losha Valus, and gestured to the slain shades scattered around the Sidar throne room. Losha and the other vampires accompanying Decius raised them as skeletons.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Face me Sandalphon, or every Sidar man, woman, and child we have killed or will ever find will be raised as a skeleton and sent to hunt you down. Will you enjoy your long life being forever invisible?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No!" Sandalphon's rage was the first emotion he had shown. "Leave them be. You have no right to abuse the dead. These bodies are all that remains in this world of our friends, and you have no right to enslave them. I will yield to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius nodded, and Losha released the bodies of the slain shades. "I want to know why you attacked me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Calabim are an intriguing people, not unlike us until recently. You have led them to be more aggressive with your leadership, since you did not face the hardship that they saw during the Age of Winter. After your success in the war of Tempus Mor, we predicted a resurgent Calabim ruling over the entire world, and feasting on the Sidar. The risk of this outweighed the risk of revealing ourselves, and so we activated our assassins in the area. Unfortunately, only Rathus accomplished his goal."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He was the one who struck at the Elohim, then? I have a friend who badly wants his sword." Decius pulled out the Nether Blade that they had taken from Rathus's corpse and examined it. Green runes pulsed along the light ebon blade. "What makes this sword special?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Nether Blade is an artifact from the underworld. Its power draws any it slays into Arawn's lands and anchors them in his vault."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Hmm. I think this might be better than whatever Os-Gabella could offer me. It isn't enough to compensate us for all that we have lost since your attack on us... but I dare not invite you into our midst; it would only be inviting my death. We will take what we need of your supplies and leave you here in peace, to live your long, quiet, isolated lives. But the secrets of the Sidar will be spread far and wide among the Calabim. If you strike at us again, everything that you have built will be destroyed and your people will be put to death and then enslaved until the end of time."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is as generous as we can expect from you, I am well aware," Sandalphon replied. Suddenly from behind him another ghost appeared, drawing their attention. "Belthus, welcome back," Sandalphon said. "How went your mission?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric Ulvin's war will not be stopped so easy. I could not get near him. He radiates with the power of Winter, a power not seen on Erebus for generations, and his army grows more numerous. It seems the endless winter is more likely than we thought."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who is this Auric Ulvin?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Belthus, this is Decius of the Calabim. We were just discussing the future sovereignty of the Sidar in light of the Calabim's brutal conquest. Decius, we have our eye on more than just the nations nearest us. In the distant Aquillo Tundra occur events that could trouble us even here. Auric is a magical prodigy, and this power made him a suitable vessel for the machinations of the power of winter. Mulcarn was killed by the Godslayer, leaving his sphere without a suitable ruler. Auric has drawn together the tools of that god, and is preparing to become its avatar. Belthus was sent to stop him, but we acted too late. If the armies gathering against him do not stop him, he will return all Erebus to an Age of Winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked at the sword he held in his hands for a moment, then he sheathed it. "What if a god was not slain with the Godslayer, but trapped by the Nether Blade?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon shrugged. "We have no experience with that."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric poses a grave threat. We will go to support those who stand against him, and if the Nether Blade staves off this threat for good, perhaps it can rid me of my troublesome allies as well."

"This is but a room," the voice said, "And your entrance here means nothing. We will leave this place and find another."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This isn't the first of your cities that have been conquered, shade. I will not give up until you yield. The world is not as big as it once was, when it emerged from winter wild and open. Places to hide are running out."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon appeared behind him. "What do you want, Decius? A Sidar assassin to strike against your father in Torrolerial? He has his hands full with the Doviello invasion, I think. Would you prefer we poison the Calabim lords? We prefer not to draw the attention of other immortals to ourselves; we are still new at this and they may know more than us."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You know so much about me, do you? I think it is time for you to start answering my questions."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Giving answers isn't what we do. We watch and plan and wait and, if absolutely necessary, we act, without the world knowing we were here. To preserve the Sidar and our seclusion." Sandalphon faded from view again. Decius turned to Vaughn, and the Paladin brought forth a relic of Lugus, flooding the room with light, revealing Sandalphon sitting calmly on his throne. "You seem to have me at a disadvantage. What are your terms?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I want to know why you attacked Ethne and me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You were both instrumental in leading the war in Tempus Mor, dangerously close to this secluded valley. And you were winning. Based on our observations of your actions in the desert of Myrh, we calculated that an empowered Overcouncil flush with victory would try to expand its position here, attempting to bring us under their 'enlightened' sovereignty. The risk of inaction seemed greater than the risk of action, so we activated our assassins in the region, to attempt to bring a stalemate to the battle and dissuade you from going further. Unfortunately, our plans failed, and here you are."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is what you do? You decide who lives and dies based on what you think that they will do?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon sneered at Decius, the first hint of emotion that he displayed. "You are so much better? You are a ruler-you decide who lives and dies among the untold number that dwell within your borders. Among your soldiers you execute those who betray or desert you, and unleash them on those who would stand against you. You exercise the power of the judge over many, yet you take offense at we who dare to judge only a few, only the kings or priests or generals?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have no authority over me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We have the same authority over you that you have over your citizens-we have the power to act on our judgments."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius sighed. "I had come hoping to take you as my vassal, to use you against my enemies. I see now that that would be a foolish plan, only inviting my death or that of my heir. Here is what I propose instead. Give me an advisor. We will leave you to yourselves, to live your long, quiet, isolated lives, but send one of your number to sit in our councils, not as a member but to warn us before you strike. Why should my death be your first course of action?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon considered him. "This is acceptable. Provided that you personally tell no one of our existence. You can work through your council to see that our few interests are maintained, and we shall likewise leave the world alone for as long as we think wise."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There is one other condition. I want the soul of Ethne freed. She was slain and cannot be resurrected."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Elohim woman... Rathus took the Nether Blade when he attacked her, because she knows the secrets of the Mercurian Gate, passed down through the regents of the Elohim."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There is no point it slaying her for that now; the secret has been used, and spread throughout the Empyrean to Bourne the Gleaming. Release her spirit."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Nether Blade is an artifact from the underworld. It will draw the soul of anyone it slays into Arawn's realm and anchors them there. Destroying it should free those whose souls belong elsewhere. Free them to serve their true lord, be it in their vault or recalled to Erebus."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Then I shall do so, and free Ethne to return to her people." Decius pulled out the blade that they had taken from Rathus's corpse and studied it for a moment. Green runes pulsed along the light ebon blade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Behind Sandalphon another Ghost appeared suddenly, drawing their attention. "Belthus, welcome back," Sandalphon said. "How went your mission?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric Ulvin's war will not be stopped so easy. I could not get near him. He radiates with the power of Winter, a power not seen on Erebus for generations, and his army grows more numerous. It seems the endless winter is more likely than we thought."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric Ulvin? I know that name..." said Decius.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who is this?" asked Belthus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Decius leads the Malakim army. They have discovered us, but we have come to an understanding."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Varn Gosam met Auric Ulvin. Varn gave up his vaunted position among a secluded elven tribe to free him, though it would have cost them both their lives had Auric's great power not manifested."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric is a magical prodigy, and this power made him a suitable vessel for the machinations of the power of winter. Mulcarn was killed by the Godslayer, leaving his sphere without a suitable ruler. Auric has drawn together the tools of that god, and is preparing to become its avatar. Belthus was sent to stop him, but we acted too late. If the armies gathering against him do not stop him, he will return all Erebus to an Age of Winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked at the sword he held in his hands for a moment, then he sheathed it. "What if a god was not slain with the Godslayer, but trapped by the Nether Blade?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon shrugged. "We have no experience with that. I thought you intended to free your friend?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric poses a grave threat. We will go to support those who stand against him, and if the Nether Blade staves off this threat for good... I can only hope that Ethne forgives me."
Against the Wall
TEXT.German: Gegen die Mauer

TEXT.English: Description: The Khazad mean to move onto the surface of Erebus, but they are harassed by the mercenary armies of the Hippus. If you can build a surface empire and hold them against their attacks they will give up their assault on this area.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: To win this scenario you must build 5 cities and hold them for at least 100 turns.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung:

TEXT.English: Build at least 5 cities
TEXT.German: Gründet mindestens 5 Städte

TEXT.English: Hold your cities for %d1 more turns
TEXT.German: Haltet Eure Städte noch für %d1 weitere [NUM1:Runde:Runden]

TEXT.English: "Where you die I will die, and there I will be buried. May the Lord deal with me, be it ever so severely, if anything but death separates you and me."-ancient Umberguard intonement[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dwarves bent down and clutched the ground. They squeezed until their knuckles turned white from the strain and almost crawled across the mountainside refusing to let go with both hands at once. One group sat huddled beneath a rocky outcropping, as if trying to evade a storm, though the day was sunny and beautiful.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Palais Adien stood just outside the tunnel entrance and stared into the sky. He slowly began to sway, then collapsed and vomited all over the ground. His brothers rushed to him, all careful not to look up.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Arturus watched his kin struggle. A wild hare stopped briefly to look at the odd dwarves before hopping away. The dwarves were as equally confused by the bouncing rabbit as it was by the slinking dwarves.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Look out across the plains," Arturus shouted and then he waited for all the dwarves to do as he commanded. From here he could see the green and browns of distant hills, the blues of inland lakes and the rich yellows of fertile valleys. Once the dwarves were all looking Arturus continued.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The mountain does not move. Even as the wind strikes it, as storms rage against it the mountain does not move. With the open sky above and the underhome below, as ages pass, as empires and gods battle the mountain does not move."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At this point Arturus was standing in the open. He could see the fear in his clansmen's eyes as they looked at him. With only his feet touching the earth, as if he would be sucked off into the unknown. But he remained solid and determined.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We will be as the mountain. We will build the first Khazad surface cities here since the Age of Magic. And though we may face the dangers of this world, though creatures or the empires of men may attack we, like the mountain, will not move."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One by one the dwarves stood then together they walked down the mountainside toward the site of their first city.

The men were simply gone. Arturus didn't know if their gold ran out or if they simply tired of the war. Such are the ways of men that the passions of one day are forgotten tomorrow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Regardless, the tide of onrushing horsemen had stopped and the Khazad were firmly entrenched upon the surface of Erebus.
TEXT.German: Die Männer waren einfach weg. Arturus wußte nicht, ob sich ihre Goldvorräte erschöpft hatten oder ob sie einfach nur kriegsmüde geworden waren. So flüchtig sind die Gedanken der Menschen, dass die Leidenschaften des einen Tages am nächsten schon vergessen sind.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dessen ungeachtet ist die Flut von anstürmenden Reitern verschwunden und die Khazad haben auf der Oberfläche von Erebus starke Wurzeln geschlagen.

TEXT.English: Barbarian Assault
TEXT.German: Angriff der Barbaren

TEXT.English: These jungles are not as easily tamed as the Umbrawood. This is no place for elves, or men.
TEXT.German: Dieser Dschungel ist nicht so einfach zu zähmem wie der Umbrawald. Dies ist kein Ort für Elfen, oder Menschen.

TEXT.English: Even mighty stones wear to the steady pressure of rivers and tides. So are we before the unending hordes of the Clan.
TEXT.German: Selbst gewaltige Felsen werden vom stetigen Druck der Flüsse und Gezeiten abgetragen. So stehen wir vor den endlosen Horden des Klans.

TEXT.English: The taint of Labruscum will endure. There must be some small part of Bannor strength left within these beasts.
TEXT.German: Der Schandfleck von Labruscum wird überdauern. In diesen Bestien muss noch ein kleiner Teil der bannorischen Stärke übrig sein.

TEXT.English: I will not bear the yoke of Sheelba any longer. You can have this poisoned jungle, there is better hunting elsewhere.
TEXT.German: Ich werde das Joch von Sheelba nicht länger ertragen. Ihr könnt diesen vergifteten Dschungel haben, woanders gibt es bessere Jagdgründe.

TEXT.English: We are best to surrender the Labruscum entirely to the canticle of fire. I would do so, but the Clan may be crazed enough to enjoy it.
TEXT.German: Es wird am besten sein, Labruscum vollständig dem Lobgesang des Feuers zu übergeben. Ich würde es tun, aber der Klan ist wahrscheinlich verrückt genug, um sich daran zu erfreuen.

TEXT.English: I pray that you follow me out of this jungle before it is too late. I have no desire to see another barrow raised in this land, or to find you buried beneath it.
TEXT.German: Ich bete, dass Ihr mir aus diesem Dschungel folgt, bevor es zu spät ist. Ich habe kein Verlangen danach zu sehen, wie in diesem Land ein weiterer Grabhügel errichtet wird, oder Euch darunter begraben zu finden.

TEXT.English: A thousand will come after me. We will defeat you with our strength our drown you in our blood. There is no victory to be found here.
TEXT.German: Eintausend werden nach mit kommen. Wir werden Euch mit unserer Stärke und Euch in Eurem eigenen Blut ersäufen. Hier gibt es keinen Sieg zu finden.

TEXT.English: I am not being paid nearly enough for this war. I leave you to your convictions, I will seek my glory elsewhere.
TEXT.German: Ich werde für diesen Krieg nicht annähernd gut genug bezahlt. Ich überlasse Euch Eurem Urteil und werde mir meinen Ruhm woanders suchen.

TEXT.English: Description: Labruscum has long been the home of the Clan of Embers. If they can be removed here their grip on Erebus will be weakened.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: The lowest ranked player will be removed every 50 turns until only 5 players remain. This does not apply to the Clan of Embers players.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reward: Completing this scenario reduces the amount of Barbarians in all other scenarios.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Labruscum ist schon lange die Heimat des Klans der Asche gewesen. Wenn er hier vernichtend geschlagen werden kann, wird sich sein Griff um Erebus lockern.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Der Spieler mit der niedrigsten Wertung wird alle 50 Runden aus der Partie entfernt, bis nur noch 5 Spieler übrig sind. Dies gilt nicht für Spieler, die den Klan der Asche gewählt haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Bei erfolgreichem Abschluss dieses Szenarios verringert sich die Anzahl der Barbaren in allen anderen Szenarien.

TEXT.English: Defeat Sheelba!
TEXT.German: Besiege Sheelba!

TEXT.English: The jungles of Labruscum cover what once was the heart of the Bannor empire. The fall of the Queen of Fire reduced that nation to ash and transformed her followers into a savage mix of orcs, goblins and other savage humanoids. Now Labruscum serves as the recruiting ground for the Clan of Embers, and if the Clan is to be stopped they must be defeated here.
TEXT.German: Der Dschungel von Labruscum verbirgt, was einst das Herz des bannorischen Reiches war. Der Sturz der Königin des Feuers verwandelte diese Nation zu Asche und ihre Anhänger zu einer wilden Mischung aus Orks, Goblins und anderen Primitiven. Heute dient Labruscum als Rekrutierungsstätte des Klans der Asche. Falls der Klan gestoppt werden soll, muss er hier besiegt werden.

TEXT.English: Labruscum is under your control. Without their wildlands the Clan's grip on Erebus is weakened and your homeland will be spared the worst of their raids. Civilization will rise again from the jungle ruins.
TEXT.German: Labruscum ist unter Eurer Kontrolle. Ohne seine Rückzugsgebiete in der Wildnis ist der Griff des Klans um Erebus geschwächt und Eure Heimat wird in Zukunft von den schlimmsten Überfällen verschont bleiben. Die Zivilisation wird sich erneut aus den Dschungelruinen erheben.

TEXT.English: Beneath the Heel
TEXT.German: Unter dem Absatz

TEXT.English: I should have known better than to trust mercenaries for my defense. You are too weak to serve a god.
TEXT.German: Ich hätte es besser wissen und meine Verteidigung nicht Söldnern anvertrauen sollen. Ihr seid zu schwach, um einem Gott zu dienen.

TEXT.English: We stood alone against the Illians at the end of the Age of Magic. We will rise up again.
TEXT.German: Wir standen den Illianern am Ende des Zeitalters der Magie allein gegenüber. Wir werden erneut aufsteigen.

TEXT.English: Is the hope of man so easily lost? Given away for a few gold and sold to simple bandits. Is this how we will lose this age?
TEXT.German: Ist die Hoffnung der Menschen so schnell verloren? Verschenkt für ein bisschen Gold und verkauft an einfache Banditen. Wird uns dieses Zeitalter etwa so entgleiten?

TEXT.English: My golems would have crushed you, if you would only stand still...
TEXT.German: Meine Golems hätten Euch zu Staub zermahlen, wenn Ihr nur still gestanden wärt...

TEXT.English: Each man eventually becomes food for another, today my legacy is ended.
TEXT.German: Jeder Mensch wird schließlich zur Beute eines anderen. Heute ist mein Vermächtnis beendet.

TEXT.English: You are a puppet for the White Hand, they will sacrifice you when it serves their needs.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid nur eine Marionette für die Weiße Hand. Sie werden Euch opfern, wenn es ihnen gelegen kommt.

TEXT.English: Description: Regain the Pieces of Barnaxus for Auric Ulvin.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: You cannot train units, instead they must be purchased. Auric pays you a bounty for every enemy unit you defeat. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Blood of Angels scenario.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Bringt für Auric Ulvin die Teile von Barnaxus in Euren Besitz.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Einheiten können nicht aufgestellt werden, sondern müssen gegen Gold angeworben werden. Auric zahlt Euch ein Kopfgeld für jede Einheit, die Ihr besiegt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Der Kult".

TEXT.English: Capture the Pieces of Barnaxus and take them to the Illian capital
TEXT.German: Bringt die Teile von Barnaxus in Euren Besitz und schafft sie in die illianischen Hauptstadt

TEXT.English: Thick curls of smoke floated up from the camp's remains. Whatever army had camped there was gone now.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It's like chasing the wind," Lucian said in frustration, "what is the point of a mercenary army if you can never catch up with them long enough to hire them?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Is it possible they were defeated here; I heard they were involved in the war between the sandmen and the cabal."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric considered Riuros's suggestion, "Maybe. There must be survivors from one side or the other, send out the scouts and see if they can track some down. I want to talk to any Hippus they find, so make sure they aren't attacked."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That last instruction was for Lucian; the Doviello scouts were excellent trackers but horrible diplomats.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A few days later they had three different reports from the scouts. One reported Hippus commanders in the Calabim city of Acaia gloating of their victory and the wisdom hiring them. Another reported disheveled Hippus units in the Malakim city of Bryn that spoke of a crushing loss on the plains. The last reported a significant Hippus army massed in a nearby valley, looking unbloodied and well rested.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But when they arrived at the valley the Hippus were gone, as were any signs that they had been there. The scout stared dumbfounded at the empty valley and would have been beaten for leading the army to the empty valley if Riuros didn't spot a small band of riders under the Hippus flag heading toward them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There were four riders. Tasunke was as close as the Hippus had to a king, and his three captains let him do the talking. After introductions Tasunke asked if Auric wanted to hire the Hippus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes," Auric answered, "the capture of Torrolerial and Midgar has deepened our treasury but shortened our time. I want to hire you to go to the Finnian Fields and recover an item from the Luchuirp, a golem named Barnaxus."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"How are we to know which golem is the right one? Battle doesn't often allow for the exchange of pleasantries."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric paused, then to the surprise of Lucian and the priests he ignored Tasunke's sarcasm and returned only a thin, insincere smile.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Barnaxus has the mark of the white hand upon him. Find the golem with that mark and bring him to me to earn your reward."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That we can do." Tasunke replied, "But I will need money to finance the move of my army to the Finnian Fields. The Luchuirp aren't likely to give up their golem so easily."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric thought carefully before responding.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I will pay for every enemy you kill upon the fields. Show dedication to your task and you will be able to bring your men. Relax in valley camps and pretend to fight wars and you will get no money from me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am agreed. We will see you on the fields." And with that Tasunke and his captains were off.

"Sorry he couldn't be brought back in better shape, he put up a fight."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric ignored Tasunke's comment. He was staring reverently at the broken pieces of Barnaxus that Tasunke had laid on the meeting rooms sturdy table. Auric touched each piece carefully, as if they were religious artifacts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lucian stood near the door of the chamber, seeming the least confused by Auric's actions but only because he had given up trying to understand them. Dumannios, Riuros, and Anagantios all watched Auric carefully, sensing something deeply significant in the golem's shattered parts but unable to tell what. Tasunke just waited to get paid.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The room's only other occupant was caged. Beeri Bawl, Luchuirp king, sat ignobly in an old wolf pen that Tasunke had dragged along as a special present for Auric. Beeri was the most surprised to find that Barnaxus was not only the cause of the war with the Hippus, but of so much interest to the Illian priests.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is not a golem," Auric began, "he is not powered by gears and dwarven enchantment but by the divine breath of Mulcarn himself. This is the last piece of Mulcarn, that which was untouched by the Godslayer."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Oh yeah, that golem's a god. I got a pair of boots made out of Bhall's panties too if you're interested. They smell kinda funny but sure do keep your toes warm on a cold night."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Everyone but Auric glowered at Beeri, but he only crossed his arms and stared back at them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric placed his hands on the chest of the broken golem and began chanting. The spell started low and quiet as he repeated each incantation. To Tasunke it sounded like a lullaby, but in a language he had never heard. It wasn't harsh or chaotic like the spells he was used to hearing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As Auric continued to cast the room chilled to the point where everyone's breath could be seen. Outside of Auric's spell the rest of the sound dimmed and Beeri yelled and thrashed against the bars of his cage, but it went unnoticed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Barnaxus's chest began to glow. As everyone watched a white radiance spread along the broken pieces and then gathered in his chest before flaring in the symbol of a white hand. The flare was so bright everyone was momentarily blinded, but when they could see again the shadow of Mulcarn stood above the table.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dumannios, Riuros, and Anagantios fell to their knees. Tasunke felt his knees wobble, as if subconsciously wanting to worship the figure before him, but he resisted.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Mulcarn wasn't there, he wasn't real. It was only a glimmer of his power like the glow of sunlight after it has passed beneath the mountains. But still there was godhood in that image. And in that moment, with Auric standing arms outstretched before the last remnant of Mulcarn's power he did look like a man ascending to heaven.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The light turned to pale mist and Auric breathed it in. His body strained against the energy that coursed through it, then faded leaving him triumphant and weary for the experience. The three priests continued praying, but did so now at Auric's feet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Looking at Lucian Auric said, "See that the horse lord is paid well for his service."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tasunke smiled, "and what of the dwarf I brought you?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric considered Beeri closely, "He's very funny. Sell him to Perpentach, I'm sure the Momus can use another jester."
Blood of Angels
TEXT.German: Blut der Engel

TEXT.English: If a man is killed in his sleep, he is not to blame, but the faithless cur that slept at his feet.
I know too well the drive of madness, and I know where it will take you. There are worse things than lost battles and burnt cities.
This will not be the age of the Doviello, such days are past.
Without the threat of hell the Bannor have grown weak. Capria will return from the Fane reforged. The Bannor can withstand any army if their faith is maintained.

Description: Auric needs divine blood to start his rituals. Lead him in his campaign against the Bannor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Declarations of war are controlled by the scenario.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Return of Winter scenario.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Auric benötigt göttliches Blut, um mit seinen Ritualen beginnen zu können. Führt ihn in einen Feldzug gegen die Bannor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Kriegserklärungen werden vom Szenario vorgegeben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Unter dem Absatz".

TEXT.English: Capture the Bannor city of Torrolerial
TEXT.German: Nehmt die bannorische Stadt Torrolerial ein

TEXT.English: Capture the Grigori city of Midgar
TEXT.German: Nehmt die grigorische Stadt Midgar ein

TEXT.English: Auric spent days within his tent as the army waited. He wasn't planning or meeting with his captains, but possessed of a deep depression and sleeping. No one was able to rouse him from his tent and those that tried were met either with anger or simply ignored. The aenemic Illian warriors feared upcoming battles and the Doviello complained that there wasn't battle enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Until the morning Auric walked out and viewed the milling troops. He was once again a god king and at his command the army rose up and was ready to march. He spoke of their upcoming victories, of the returning God of Winter, blood enough to satiate the savage Doviello and the glory of a world once again under the hand of the Illians. And the army cheered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This was his way, battling between inhuman passion and despair. Both emotions overwhelmed and drove him on.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Only the immortals can funnel the divine, if I mean to ascend it will be through their blood."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lucian followed behind Auric and his captains. The captains asked questions, and Auric answered cryptically or not at all, they advised against direct attack on the civilized lands and Auric was disgusted with them. He finally turned at looked at the trailing Lucian.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"What of the Doviello, have you the courage to reclaim your place beside winter's throne?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My men are ready," Lucian answered, "how would you like them deployed?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric smiled. "Your faith will be rewarded. We will attack into the Bannor lands, we will assault their capital and march into their largest cathedral. Within there is a holy chamber where loyal Sabathiel rests. We will enter and pull the archangel from the chamber, and then sacrifice him on the cathedral floor to power our ritual."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Illian captains' white skin paled even further; they were shocked beyond speech.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lucian replied, "When you command it, the Doviello will be ready."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric nodded and Lucian returned to his men. They grumbled at the wasted days and he promised they would have ample opportunity to fight ahead. Lucian kept his concerns to himself.

Lucian loosed his men to ravage Torrolerial. The battle had been hard fought and they had earned their reward. He followed Auric into the cathedral flanked by Illian captains who cut down the remaining priests defending the building.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The walls were covered in scenes of the Bannor's battles in hell. In each Sabathiel or Capria stood protectively over the loyal soldiers. In one a single Bannor soldier stood before a closing portal with a host of demons around him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At the center of cathedral was a chamber covered with the symbols of Junil. A door set with a blazing sword was the only way into the chamber and the laws to enter were inscribed on it. It claimed that the area beyond was between this world and heaven, that it was sanctified ground and that only the high priests could open or pass through the door.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric ignored the warnings and threw the door open. Lucian readied his axe; he didn't know what to expect from an archangel but his axe hadn't failed him yet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But the chamber beyond was empty. There was only dust inside, no one had entered the chamber for years.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Has Sabathiel fled?" one of the captains asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No." Despite his frustration Auric smiled. "The priests have been lying to the people. They claim that their laws are passed down from the archangel that protected them in hell but he abandoned them long ago. But they continue to use his legend to control the Bannor. This lie has cost them their capital."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And what of our ritual?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It seems we have another debt to repay. Sabathiel is not the only archangel in Erebus-there is one within the Grigori lands as well."

Midgar burned. The Grigori capital was a stark contrast to that of the Bannor. Where the Bannor had temples the Grigori have meeting halls. Where the Bannor had religious symbols the Grigori had graceful art. Most noticeably the architecture of Alexandria shared a common design of fortified buildings, flags and banners. The Grigori buildings were as dissimilar as the people who made them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But the tapestry of buildings was united by the palace at its center. There was nothing like it in the city and its beautiful black and copper parapets were a source of inspiration for all the citizens. A testament to what men could create. When he wasn't in his throne room Cassiel himself spent hours within the palace's towers, looking out over his city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]No doubt Cassiel knew we were coming. Many had fled from the city before Auric's army arrived. Lucian assumed the palace would be as empty as Sabathiel's chamber within the cathedral. Auric was becoming more despondent as they marched toward the capital, and in the past few days even the news of their victories had gone unnoticed as he was retreating more and more into the grip of depression.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But this morning he arose again reborn. And everyone scrambled to keep up with him as he marched through the capital toward the palace. Ignoring the orders to flee a few loyal craftsmen defended the palace, their love for their king overruling their fear of the invading armies. Their defense was short lived and Auric marched into the throne room.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cassiel stood in the center of the chamber. He was tall, and perfectly formed, as if a sculptor had formed the ideal man out of marble. There was no doubt that he was an archangel and in his eyes you could see the wisdom gained in his immortal life, and the weight of its burden upon him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I worried that I would need to raze every Grigori city in Erebus before I would find you." Auric said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Leave my children be, I am the one you want."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With that Auric commanded the Illian captains forward and they bound the archangel with four massive iron manacles brought especially for the purpose. Cassiel's clothes were torn off and a team of men took each chain, two for his arms and two for his legs and pulled them taunt. Lifting Cassiel off the ground and stretching him out until he screamed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Those screams echoed through the palace halls and out into the city. There was so much torment and pain in them that everyone paused, saddened by their sound. Where Doviello soldiers brutally beat the last of the city's defenders both stopped to listen to the cries. For the first time the Doviello questioned their battle, and the dying Grigori shared tears with their leader.[PARAGRAPH:1]"There is a rescue waiting for you" Auric taunted, "A god who may be willing to accept you back in his ara. Will you trade the ideology of three ages for a chance to retain your immortal soul? Are you willing to admit that you exist only to serve the gods? How do you feel about divine intervention now that it is the only thing that can save you?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cassiel didn't reply except to scream louder as his shoulders were ripped from their sockets with a dull pop. His shoulders flushed deep purple with blood and his arms rotated without restriction, only held to his body by skin and a few remaining tendons.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric took out a copper dagger and held it over Cassiel's heart.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And when you die what heaven will accept you? I suspect only Agares will accept one who has so openly defied the gods."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You are a farmer's son," Cassiel replied with great strain, "a boy who loved reading and nature. This voice that drives is not you. It promises power but it will imprison you. You must give up this war or you will ruin many lives, including your own."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric ignored the warning and plunged the dagger into Cassiel's heart. The archangel's scream echoed throughout the capital. The men holding the chains continued pulling in those last few seconds until Cassiel died and then they let his body drop onto the floor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Everyone except Auric waited to see if Cassiel would be reborn, but he didn't move. Auric was finishing the ritual with the bloodied dagger. Slowly, carefully, he completed the spell by pushing the daggers blade into his right hand, cutting his flesh and allowing his blood to mix with the dead archangel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In that moment, in a thousand different places in Erebus prophets received visions of a white dragon swallowing the world. Priests were overcome with a sense of foreboding and a cool wind blew through even the warmest areas. Auric's ascension had begun.
Load this to play any of the Fall from Heaven II scenarios
TEXT.German: Lade hier die Fall from Heaven 2 Szenarios die du spielen willst.

TEXT.English: Fall of Cuantine
TEXT.German: Der Fall von Cuantine

TEXT.English: The commander of Tor Alessi sends his thanks for clearing the barrow. He had some siege equipment commissioned that he no longer needs and he gifts it to your war effort.
TEXT.German: Der Befehlshaber von Tor Alessi sendet seinen Dank für die Räumung des Grabhügels. Er hatte einige Belagerungsmaschinen in Auftrag gegeben, die er nun nicht mehr benötigt und gerne Euren Kriegsbemühungen zur Verfügung stellt.

TEXT.English: "Welcome, Decius. We have been expecting you. My name is Confessor Wallon. It is Sabathiel's will that I accompany you. The Diviners' have great fears about the safety of our southwest settlements, indeed, of the whole empire if the threat growing there spreads. We should set out there at once."
TEXT.German: "Willkommen, Decius. Wir haben dich schon erwartet. Mein Name ist Bekenner Wallon. Es ist der Wille von Sabathiel, dass ich dich begleite. Die Wahrsager haben große Angst um die Sicherheit unserer südwestlichen Siedlungen, tatsächlich fürchten sie sogar um die Sicherheit des gesamten Reiches, falls sich die Bedrohung ausbreitet, die dort heranwächst. Wir sollten uns sofort dorthin begeben."

TEXT.English: A confessor has joined your ranks.
TEXT.German: Ein Bekenner hat sich Euch angeschlossen.

TEXT.English: Description: The Bannor Empire is a nation born of tragedy, struggle, and endless war. A people sustained by piety, honor, and unyielding discipline. An uncompromising people gathers many enemies, but the Bannor have no shortage of heroes. Such as Decius, a man brave, loyal, and ever steadfast. But an uncompromising man gains many enemies as well. In the Fall of Cuantine, Decius is called upon to face a threat that grows near the heart of the Empire, in the seemingly peaceful Adian Fields...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Rosier must survive.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Das Reich der Bannor ist eine Nation, die aus Tragödien, Überlebenskämpfen und endlosen Kriegen geboren wurde. Ein Volk, das von Frömmigkeit, Ehre und unbeugsamer Disziplin zusammengehalten wird. Ein unnachgiebiges Volk macht sich zwar viele Feinde, aber die Bannor haben keinen Mangel an Helden. Wie etwa Decius, ein tapferer, loyaler und allzeit unerschütterlicher Mann. Aber ein unnachgiebiger Mann macht sich ebenfalls viele Feinde. In "Der Untergang von Cuantine" ist Decius aufgefordert, einer Bedrohung gegenüber zu treten, das nahe des Herzens des Reiches wächst, in den scheinbar friedvollen Adian-Feldern...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Rosier muss überleben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "In die Wüste".

TEXT.English: Take your units to the city Brigit's Light Abbey
TEXT.German: Bringt Eure Einheiten zur Stadt Brigit's Light Abbey

TEXT.English: Defeat the twisted men in the southern jungle and destroy their lair
TEXT.German: Besiegt die verdorbenen Menschen im südlichen Dschungel und zerstört ihren Bau

TEXT.English: Research Orders from Heaven to gain Rosier and pillage Muirin's lair
TEXT.German: Erforscht die Technologie "Weisung des Himmels", um Rosier zu erhalten, und plündert Muirins Bau

TEXT.English: Wait for the twisted men to return to their homes
TEXT.German: Wartet auf die Rückkehr der verdorbenen Menschen zu ihren Lagern

TEXT.English: Raze the Octopus Overlord's holy city
TEXT.German: Schleift die Heilige Stadt der Schatten der Tiefe

TEXT.English: Defeat the Drown attacking Cuantine
TEXT.German: Besiegt die Ertränkten, die Cuantine angreifen

TEXT.English: Decius wipes the goblin blood from his sword and without pause begins the next task-razing the fort the goblins were using to launch attacks at the Bannor outpost. He is soon interrupted by a messenger. "Decius Achare, you are requested by the Lady Commanders." Decius nods and sets his men to tearing down the goblin fortifications.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Decius, I am sending you back to Torrolerial."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes milady. May I speak freely?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Of course."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Why send a man of action back to the capital? This seems a demotion to me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Capria smiles. "No, it is not a demotion nor is it my decision. The Diviner claims it is of great importance that you do so, or all of the Empire is imperiled. So go at once and report to your father." Decius turned to gather supplies, and was riding homeward within the hour.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius entered the meeting hall of House Achare's stronghold. "I have come, Lord Commander, though I know not why. Lady Capria had good use of me in the front."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lord Samatheon replied, "We are off the field, my son, you can drop my title. Your name has gained some renown, and I would grant you your command. Though you are right to suspect that I would leave you to Lady Capria until the completion of her campaign if I could. While the Diviners are as forthcoming as usual, they must be heeded, and they have expressed grave concerns about supernatural threats in this region. Since your brother has taken his command south to reinforce the Labuscrum, I need a commander I can trust for House Achare's legions. I place you in command of our expeditionary force; unfortunately you will be need an 'advisor.'"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I thank you for your trust, father, I shall do you proud."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"As the priests say, first to your god, then to your king, then to your commander. Go therefore to the Abbey of Brigit's Light, then to the duties they have for our forces. Return home when you can, for I would like much to hear news of your travels. Dismissed."
TEXT.German: Decius wischte das Goblinblut von seinem Schwert und begann sofort die nächste Aufgabe--das Fort, welches die Goblins für ihre Angriffe auf den Außenposten der Bannor benutzten, zu zerstören. Schon bald wurde er von einem Boten unterbrochen. "Decius Achare, die Kommandantin wünscht Euch zu sehen." Decius nickte und befahl seinen Männern die Befestigungen der Goblins niederzureißen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Decius, ich sende euch zurück nach Torolerial."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ja milady. Darf ich frei sprechen?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Natürlich."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Warum einen Mann der Tat zur Hauptstadt zurücksenden? Dies erscheint als Degradierung."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Capria lächelt. "Nein, es ist weder eine Degradierung noch meine Entscheidung. Der Seher sagt es ist von großer Wichtigkeit das Ihr dies tut, wenn nicht das ganze Imperium gefährdet sein soll. So gehet und meldet euch bei Eurem Vater." Daraufhin ging Decius Vorräte sammeln und war innerhalb einer Stunde auf dem Weg heimwärts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius betrat den Besprechungssaal der Festung vom Haus Achare. "Ich bin hier, Kommandant, doch weis ich nicht wieso. Lady Capria hätte mich an der Front gebrauchen können"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lord Samatheon antwortete, "Wir sind hier unter uns, mein Sohn, Du brauchst mich nicht mit meinem Titel anzusprechen. Du hast etwas Anerkennung erlangt und ich würde Dir gern Dein Kommando geben. Aber Du hast Recht das ich Dich bis zum Ende ihrer Kampagne bei Lady Capria gelassen hätte, wenn ich könnte. Auch wenn die Seher so mitteilsam wie immer sind, so müssen sie doch erhört werden, und übernatürliche Bedrohungen in der Region machen ihnen Sorgen. Da Dein Bruder nach Süden gesendet wurde um Labscrum zu verstärken brauchte ich einen Kommandanten dem ich die Truppen des Hauses Achare anvertrauen konnte. Ich gebe Dir das Kommando unserer Expeditionstruppe; leider wirst Du einen 'Berater' benötigen."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich danke Dir für dein Vertrauen, Vater, ich werde Dich stolz machen."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Wie die Priester immer sagen, erst zu Gott, dann zum König und dann zu Eurem Kommandanten. Geh denn zur Abtei von Brigits' Licht, dann zu den Aufgaben die sie für unsere Truppen haben. Kehre Heim wenn Du kannst, denn ich will viel von Deinen Taten hören. Wegtreten!

TEXT.English: Your confessor approaches you as you prepare your army to move. "Commander Decius, we have uncovered the source of the taint we discovered in the jungles. In fact, it stems from the ports of the Lanun. We had negotiated trade relations with the Lanun, but apparently they have allowed their cities to be infested by the Overlords. We must wipe out every city with the Octopus Overlords religion."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rosier says "So you only freed the twisted men in order to track them down and destroy them?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If these people have given their souls to demons, their lives are forfeit. If their Oaths hold true, they shall dwell with Junil forever. Either way we shall protect the Bannor from this taint, and the power of the good shall not fade nor flicker from the face of Erebus."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This seems less of good than of power to me, Decius." says Rosier.

A Speaker is brought before you as you watch the destruction of the Lanun's Temple of the Overlords. "Your trespass here is unforgivable! This sacred ground rings with echoes of the depths."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Your allegiance to evil has sealed your fate," Wallon says.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Fate is ours to twist, and vengeance mine to take. Rise, servants!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius scans the horizon, then shouts to his advisors, "Look to the horizon! Drown rise from the depths and head for Cuantine. We cannot get there before them on foot."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rosier says "The artifacts of these cultists, I have seen them used to travel over the water."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We cannot risk the taint these bear," the Confessor tells him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Foolish priest, it is worth the risk. You gamble the lives of our people for your purity's sake? You follow your law, then, and I will follow my own heart." Rosier dons the mask of the Speaker, and heads towards the waves.

There is a lair ahead, a dwelling of barbarians that will menace civilized lands until defeated. But this one is guarded by a Barbarian Hero. Confessor Wallon speaks, "Our forces seem reluctant to fight, despite my exhortations. I bid thee research Orders from Heaven, that we might make use of the Oath-taker Heroes. In fact, I find your tardiness to study the will of Junil disappointing, but that is a matter for another time. Heroes such as Rosier will grow more powerful with time, so you can wait until this battle is to our advantage."
Rosier must survive to complete this scenario.
TEXT.German: Rosier muss überleben, um dieses Szenario zu beenden.

TEXT.English: The Confessor walks among the ruins of the lair. "This is surely the taint Junil has warned us of. We must eliminate the camp and everyone in it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rosier is reluctant to follow his command. "Many of these twisted men were slaves and captives. By what right do we put them to the sword?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Bannor Empire is the sole beacon of hope for this world. Should we allow taint to spread this close to the heart of the Empire?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We should trust our god enough to let innocent men return to their homes."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]" ...Perhaps you are right. Very well, Commander Decius, should they give their Oath to Rosier, I will permit them return to their homes. Then we should return to the Abbey."
Gift of Kylorin
TEXT.German: Kylorins Geschenk

TEXT.English: Description: Dain means to pass the trials of the Cave of Ancestors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: This is a dungeon adventure. You control one unit through the challenges of the scenario and if that unit dies you lose.
TEXT.French: Description: Dain means to pass the pass the trials of the Cave of Ancestors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: This is a dungeon adventure. You control one unit through the challenges of the scenario and if that unit dies you lose.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Dain hat vor, die Prüfungen der Ahnengrotte zu bestehen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Dies ist ein Dungeon-Abenteuer. Der Spieler befehligt nur eine Einheit während der Herausforderungen des Szenarios, und falls diese Einheit getötet wird, ist die Partie verloren.

TEXT.English: Complete the cave's trials
TEXT.German: Absolviert die Prüfungen der Ahnengrotte

TEXT.English: During the Age of Magic Kylorin used magical trials to separate common mages from the truly talented. The things that appeared in the trials were illusions, but the risk of death was real. Most died, but the few that passed the trials went on to be some of the most powerful archmages of their age.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some or the leaders in the current age, such as Os-Gabella and Perpentach, went through these trials when Patria was still the only empire of man. Others, such as Laroth, Barbatos or Trenton Majosi are less well known survivors of the trials.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was hundreds of years into the Age of Rebirth before Dain of the Amurites, discovered the records of these magical trials. They were considered archaic, a violent reminder of Patria during its darkest hours. The culture of the Amurites celebrated public study of magic and this was seen as a more enlightened approach.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But Dain wondered how he compared to the Patrian archmages. And was even more interested in the greater talent the trial seemed to imbue in the lucky few who survived. Dain searched for, and found several locations for these trials, but most were simply empty towers, dungeons or cave labyrinths. Until in the year 441 of the fourth age Dain found the location of one that was still active.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The locals, a group of Balseraph fishermen living on the edge of their empire, long ago learned to avoid the cave; no one who entered it ever came out. They claimed death himself lived within it. They also claimed that chickens were divine, so Dain didn't take their warnings very seriously.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With a spellstaff and healing salve ready, as these were the traditional aides given to those taking the trial, Dain entered the cave.
Very good!
TEXT.German: Sehr gut!

TEXT.English: Wrong!
TEXT.German: Falsch!

TEXT.English: Courage- Makes units immune to Fear. It also slightly improves the units heal rate.
TEXT.German: Tapferkeit: Verleiht einer Einheit Immunität gegen Furcht. Außerdem erhöht sich die Heilungsrate einer Einheit leicht.

TEXT.English: Fireball- Summons a ball of fire which the caster can hurl at enemies from 2 plots away, farther if the caster has extension promotions. Fireball does fire damage to the enemy unit it strikes and some collateral damager to other units in the stack. Note that a lot of creatures, including most demons and orcs have some fire resistance, making this spell less effective against them. But some units, such as the Drown and Wood Golems are vulnerable to fire damage and take additional damage form fireballs.
TEXT.German: Feuerball: Beschwört eine Kugel aus Feuer, die der Zaubernde von 2 Geländefeldern entfernt auf Feinde werfen kann, sogar von noch weiter entfernt, wenn er über eine der Beförderung zur Erhöhung der Zauberreichweite verfügt. Ein Feuerball verursacht Schaden durch Verbrennung bei einer feindlichen Einheit, die er trifft, und leichte Kollateralschäden bei den anderen Einheiten eines Einheitenverbandes. Erwähnenswert ist, dass viele Kreaturen, einschließlich der meisten Dämonen und Orks, Feuer widerstehen können, wodurch dieser Zauber gegen sie weniger wirkungsvoll ist. Aber manche Einheiten, wie Ertränkte und Holzgolems, sind durch Feuer verwundbarer und nehmen durch Feuerbälle zusätzlichen Schaden.

TEXT.English: Floating Eye- Summons a Floating Eye which is unable to attack but useful for exploring dangerous areas without risking your caster. Floating Eyes can also see invisible units so it's a good way to find hidden enemies.
TEXT.German: Suchendes Auge: Beschwört ein Suchendes Auge, das zwar nicht angreifen kann, aber nützlich ist, um gefährliche zu erkunden, ohne das Leben des Zaubernden zu gefährden. Außerdem kann ein Suchendes Auge unsichtbare Einheiten entdecken und somit ein einfaches Mittel, um versteckte Feinde ausfindig zu machen.

TEXT.English: Only someone with arcane talent can open the chest.
TEXT.German: Nur jemand mit magischer Begabung kann die Truhe öffnen.

TEXT.English: Maelstrom- Does lightning damage to all units within 2 tiles. Be careful with it as it doesn't distinguish between enemy, neutral and friendly units and it will be treated as a declaration of war if you damage another players units with it. Maelstrom can't reduce a unit below 50% damage, so its best used to weaken enemy units before sending your warriors in to do battle.
TEXT.German: Mahlstrom: Verursacht Schaden durch Blitzschlag bei allen Einheiten innerhalb von 2 Geländefeldern. Vorsicht ist angebracht, da der Zauber nicht zwischen feindlichen, neutralen und verbündeten Einheiten unterscheidet. Daher wird jeder Schaden an einer fremden Einheit, der durch den Zauber verursacht wird, als Kriegserklärung gewertet. Ein Mahlstrom kann die Lebenspunkte einer Einheit nicht unter 50% senken und wird deshalb am besten eingesetzt, um feindliche Einheiten zu schwächen, bevor die eigentlichen Krieger in den Kampf geschickt werden.

TEXT.English: "Thank you!" the Sidar adept gasps, "I was able to slip by most of the creatures in here but the Hellhounds weren't fooled by my invisibility. Please take this potion, it will allow you to slip by the orcs that guard this maze."[PARAGRAPH:1]After handing you the potion the adept disappears.
TEXT.German: "Danke!", keuchte der sidarische Adept. "Ich konnte mich an den meisten Kreaturen hier drin vorbei schleichen, aber die Höllenhunde konnte ich mit meiner Unsichtbarkeit nicht täuschen. Bitte nehmt diesen Trank. Es wird Euch erlauben, an den Orks vorbei zu schleichen, die dieses Labyrinth bewachen."[PARAGRAPH:1]Nachdem er Euch den Trank gegeben hat, löst sich der Adept in Luft auf.

TEXT.English: Raise Skeleton- Allows you to summon a skeleton to serve you. The skeleton will last until it is killed, but as long as it exists the caster won't be able to summon any more. Skeleton can learn promotions and level up but their low strength keeps them from being that threatening. Also some of their strength comes from Death magic, which isn't used against units like Golems, Demons and other Undead.
TEXT.German: Skelett erschaffen: Erlaubt Euch, ein Skelett zu beschwören, das Euch dient. Ein Skelett wird bestehen bleiben, bis es besiegt wird. Allerdings kann der Zaubernde, solange es existiert, keine weiteren Skelette beschwören. Ein Skelett kann Beförderungen und Stufenaufstieg erlangen, aber seine geringe Stärke lässt es nicht gerade besonders bedrohlich wirken. Außerdem bezieht es einen Teil seiner Stärke aus der Todesmagie, die auf Einheiten wie Golems, Dämonen und andere Untote keine Auswirkungen hat.

TEXT.English: Spring- Use spring to transform desert tiles into plains tiles. It can also be used to put out fires in surrounding tiles.
TEXT.German: Frühling: Verwandelt ein Wüsten- in ein Ebenen-Geländefeld. Außerdem kann der Zauber eingesetzt werden, um Brände auf den umliegenden Geländefeldern zu löschen.

TEXT.English: Three years after Dain successfully passed the trial he had a Cave of Ancestors built in Cevedes. Although some still died in the trials the study of the Amurites served them well in preparing mages before they entered. The trial was always open, but never required, for any mages to enter. And some did go through before they were ready to tragic results. But outside of those mistakes it continues to be a legacy of Patria and cornerstone of Amurite tradition.
There is an air rune on the door ahead. As you approach the rune flares up and pushes you back.
TEXT.German: Auf der Tür vor Euch befindet sich eine Luft-Rune. Als Ihr Euch nähert flackert sie auf und drängt Euch zurück.

TEXT.English: There is a fire rune on the door ahead. As you approach the rune flares up and pushes you back.
TEXT.German: Auf der Tür vor Euch befindet sich eine Feuer-Rune. Als Ihr Euch nähert flackert sie auf und drängt Euch zurück.

TEXT.English: Grand Menagerie
TEXT.German: Die große Menagerie

TEXT.English: Bears are powerful predators. Left on their own they will form dens in the wild that produce more bears. Those dens could threaten your explorers, or provide an ample supply of experience for your early warriors.
TEXT.German: Bären sind mächtige Raubtiere. Wenn sie alleine herumstreunen, werden sie in der Wildnis Bärenhöhlen errichten, die mehr Bären hervorbringen. Diese Bärenhöhlen können eine Bedrohung für Eure Erkunder darstellen oder als eine üppige Quelle für Erfahrungspunkte für Eure frühen Krieger-Einheiten dienen.

TEXT.English: Although powerful, wild elephants cannot attack, so your units are safe around them. If you capture one and have the Horseback Riding technology you can train captured elephants as war elephants which are able to attack and become powerful early units.
TEXT.German: Auch wenn sie mächtig erscheinen, können wilde Elefanten nicht angreifen, so dass Eure Einheiten in ihrer Nähe sicher sind. Wenn Ihr einen einfangt und über die Technologie "Reiterei" verfügt, könnt Ihr diesen zu einem Kriegselefanten ausbilden, der angreifen und so zu einer mächtigen frühen Einheit werden kann.

TEXT.English: Because of their rarity gorillas are the most difficult animal to capture on most maps. They tend to appear in jungles, though even then you are unlikely to find large groups.
TEXT.German: Wegen ihrer Seltenheit sind Gorillas auf den meisten Karten die am schwierigsten zu fangenden Tiere. Sie neigen dazu, in Dschungeln aufzutauchen, aber selbst dann ist es unwahrscheinlich auf größere Gruppen zu treffen.

TEXT.English: The most prized of animal captures, griffons are not only formidable fighters, but their ability to fly may make them the best early explorers in the game.
TEXT.German: Die wertvollsten Tiere, die man fangen kann, sind Greifen. Sie sind nicht nur beeindruckende Flugtiere, sondern gerade durch ihr Fähigkeit zu fliegen auch die besten frühen Erkunder im Spiel.

TEXT.English: Lions are typically found in desert environments. They occasionally can grow into lion prides after kills and lion prides can form dens which spawn new lions.
TEXT.German: Löwen sind üblicherweise in Wüstengebieten zu finden. Sie können gelegentlich auch Löwenrudel bilden, nachdem sie im Kampf erfolgreich waren. Ein Löwenrudel kann eine Löwenhöhle errichten, die mehr Löwen hervorbringt.

TEXT.English: Giant spiders are invisible to all but recon units. They lay in wait in forested areas and attack units that draw to close to them. Sometimes wild giant spiders or captured ones will produce baby spiders after kills. These can grow to giant spiders after feeding.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Giant spiders are poisonous and will poison units that defeat them in combat. To get rid of this effect have your units healed by a priest or if your unit starts the turn completely healed the poison will wear off.
TEXT.German: Riesenspinnen sind für alle Einheiten außer Aufklärungseinheiten unsichtbar. Sie liegen in Wäldern auf der Lauer und greifen Einheiten an, die sich ihnen nähern. Manchmal bringen wilde oder gefangene Riesenspinnen Baby-Spinnen hervor, nachdem sie im Kampf erfolgreich waren. Diese können durch Fütterung zu Riesenspinnen heranwachsen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Riesenspinnen sind giftig und vergiften deshalb Einheiten, die eine Riesenspinne im Kampf besiegen. Um diesen Effekt zu kurieren, muss eine Einheit von einem Priester geheilt werden. Oder die Vergiftung verschwindet, falls eine Einheit die Runde vollständig geheilt beginnt.

TEXT.English: Tigers are dangerous hunters and very capable of taking out a lone scout or unguarded settler. There is more to fear in the jungles than just the lizardmen.
TEXT.German: Tiger sind gefährliche Jäger und mehr als imstande, einen einzelnen Späher oder ungeschützten Siedler zu töten. Im Dschungel gibt es weit mehr zu fürchten als nur die Echsenmenschen.

TEXT.English: Wolves can grow to packs after kills and packs can spawn new wolves when they defeat living opponents. This is similar to the den ability of bears and lions but since the wolf pack moves, it is harder for players to farm them for experience.
TEXT.German: Wölfe können Rudel bilden, nachdem sie im Kampf erfolgreich waren, und Wolfsrudel bringen neue Wölfe hervor, wenn sie lebende Gegener besiegen. Diese Fähigkeit ist den Bären und Löwen ähnlich, die Höhlen errichten können. Aber da Wolfsrudel immer in Bewegung sind, ist es schwieriger sie als Quelle für Erfahrungspunkte zu nutzen.

TEXT.English: Description: Capture the animals for Keelyn's Grand Menagerie.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Fangt die Tiere für Keelyns Große Menagerie.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Der Momus".

TEXT.English: You need %d1 more animals to build the Menagerie
TEXT.German: Ihr benötigt noch %d1 weiter[NUM1:es:e] [NUM1:Tier:Tiere], um die Menagerie zu errichten

TEXT.English: Capture a Bear and cage it in your capital
TEXT.German: Fangt einen Bären und sperrt ihn in Eurer Hauptstadt in einen Käfig

TEXT.English: Capture an Elephant
TEXT.German: Fangt einen Elefanten

TEXT.English: Capture a Gorilla and cage it in your capital
