She staggers closer as Auric raises a hand and says, "Slow..."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Everything stops, her heartbeats stretch out weak and thin, even falling to her knees takes seconds and that last breath out of her body goes on for much longer. Her hair whips around her head at a slower rate than the wind and she simply stares at it in confusion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then blue eyes command her attention. Falamar places his hands over hers, tightening her grip on the sword. She can see the pain and cold in his eyes, the strain of pushing your body past its limits, the knowledge that you are already dead but still pressing on. But still he smiles and pulls her up onto her feet with the Nether Blade between them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric looks irritated, as Rhoanna and Falamar charge forward he simply says, "Snowfall".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A wall of snow so thick even Auric is blinded by it explodes out of him, but it does not stop them. Pushing through wall of ice the sword holds and they both jam it deeply into Auric's chest. For a second there is no sound on the mountaintop as Auric stands confused. Then he screams, a scream that is echoed by the spirit of the god above him and thousands of frost spirits that hunt the mountain. Then it is all gone.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the Illian capital the light recedes into the bone colored sky leaving Rhoanna and Falamar lying alone in the center. Hippus and Lanun commanders rush in, calling for priests.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Don't think this gets you out of owing me a ship." Rhoanna quips as priests tended to both of them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I keep telling you, that was my brother-in-law." Falamar responds.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Night falls on combined armies, but no one sleeps. They are beyond tired, but still talk, laugh and celebrate on the tundra. And even a few of the Bannor soldiers relax and tell a few jokes, a sure sign that it must be a new age on Erebus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]-- Epilogue --[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne played beneath the Tulip Poplar tree. She could see the palace through a veil of fog and hear the distant sounds of the city beyond the palace grounds. Somewhere within the gardens other child ran and played, but she could not see them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This place, this dream, wrapped itself tightly around her. It was easy to believe. But nagging thoughts, the trials and pains of her life, would not let her rest. She was not a child, she was the ruler of an empire she loved, she had taken that empire to war, seen countless good soldiers die and she had been the victim of an assassin's attack.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was this last thought that jarred her from the dream. That attack, the dark blade that stole her life and carried her soul to this place. She could see it clearly now, she was a child no more.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The shape of a palace obscured by fog remained, as did the spirits of children playing in the field. The Tulip Poplar tree was gone, until she looked for it, and then it reappeared. She wore a beautiful mourning gown, which is traditional for burial among the Elohim, but Ethne suspected it wasn't real either.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As Ethne walked she found other spirits trapped within their own dreams, playing, sleeping or talking quietly to empty air. They seemed peaceful enough so she didn't disturb them. There was no wall around the palace grounds as she had imagined, and no city beyond, only the hazy surface of this world and a labyrinth of passages to chambers full of other dreams.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was impossible to tell how long she walked. Some places were pleasant, a field of flowers and wild birds, a pond where a boy and a large yellow dog played together, a mother who eternally sung to her child. Others were darker, a shadowy forest inhabited by glowing moths, a cellar where Ethne heard crying but couldn't find anyone, a lost child calling eternally for help. And some of the chambers were just strange, there was a city that ran backwards, an empty carnival where spirits ran and hid from each other and a galleon coming straight out of the ground crewed by souls ever looking unsuccessfully for land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eventually Ethne wandered onto a small farm. A single barn stood on a field that had been recently harvested, the barn itself was well stocked with grain and the smell of freshly cut wheat filled the air. A man sat on a chair in front of the barn looking at a distant village, barely visible beyond the haze.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The man looked at Ethne as she approached.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"None of it is real." He said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I know," Ethne replied startled, "did you grow up on this farm?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, on a farm like this."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Shackles snaked up through the ground and clasped onto the man wrists. Ethne turned to run but another pair grabbed her. They were both pulled through the surface of the ground, into a world without light, substance or breath. When they came out they were dropped into a summoning circle in a large vaulted ivory chamber. A man with a crown of mirrors and deep black pits instead of eyes stared at both of them. A blue skinned angel stood beside him and around the room hundreds of humans, elves, dwarves and orcs stood watching. Ethne knew they were all great people from many ages, kings and heroes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ethne. Auric." The man without eyes said, "Welcome to my palace. There are only two choices in the world of the dead, you wait endlessly, or you rebel. I am the leader of that rebellion, I am Laroth."
TEXT.German: Bald!

TEXT.English: Return of Winter
TEXT.German: Rückkehr des Winters

TEXT.English: The Kuriotates loyalty is admirable, but it has made them soft. You wonder how such a compliant people could present a threat to the Doviello. But their vaults show the benefit of their accumulation, you capture 250 gold from their treasury.
TEXT.German: Die Loyalität der Kuriotate ist bewundernswert, aber sie hat sie auch weich gemacht. Ihr fragt Euch, wie solch ein nachgiebiges Volk jemals eine Gefahr für die Doviello darstellen konnte. Aber ihre Schatzkammern zeigen die Vorzüge ihrer Haltung, als Ihr 250 Gold ihres Staatsschatzes findet.

TEXT.English: Description: Mahala has commanded you to aide the Illians. If they are to survive you must destroy the armies that are arrayed against them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: If the Illians are destroyed you lose.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Mahala hat Euch befohlen, den Illianern zu helfen. Wenn sie überleben sollen, müsst Ihr die Armeen vernichten, die sich ihnen entgegenstellen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Falls die Illianer ausgelöscht werden, ist die Partie verloren.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Blut der Engel".

TEXT.English: Protect the Illians by defeating all the other civilizations!
TEXT.German: Schütze die Illianer indem du alle anderen Nationen vernichtest

TEXT.English: The Age of Rebirth has begun and new empires are forming across Erebus. As the snow retreats so does the power of the Doviello. Our people turn on each other for our meager resources or abandon us entirely. Within a few generations most believe we will be gone, the starving pet of a defeated god.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But our prophets say that there is hope. A man born among the Illians is the resurrected form of Mulcarn and can ascend into the role of the god of winter. Some refuse to listen, but there is no alternative if we are to survive. You gather your tribe, to deliver this message and your allegiance to the Illians but you arrive to find them under attack. The "goodly" empires have banded together to wipe them out, if the man in the prophecy is to survive you must save the Illians from the attack.
TEXT.German: Das Zeitalter der Wiedergeburt hat begonnen und neue Reiche enstehen überall auf Erebus. Mit dem Rückzug des Eises geht auch die Macht der Doviello zu Ende. Unsere Leute kämpfen untereinander um unsere mageren Ressourcen oder verlassen unser Volk gleich ganz. Viele glauben, dass wir innerhalb weniger Generationen verschwunden sein werden, das verhungernde Schoßtier eines besiegten Gottes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Aber unsere Propheten sagen, dass es noch Hoffnung gibt. Ein Mann, ein gebürtiger Illian, trägt den wiederauferstandenen Mulcarn in sich und kann zum Gott des Winters aufsteigen. Einige weigern sich zuzuhören, aber es gibt keine Alternative, wenn wir überleben wollen. Ihr versammelt Euren Stamm, um diese Nachricht zu überbringen und den Illian Eure Gefolgschaft zu schwören, aber als Ihr ankommt, werden sie bereits angegriffen. Die "guten" Reiche haben sich zusammengeschlossen, um die Illian auszurotten. Wenn der Mann aus der Prophezeiung überleben soll, müsst Ihr den Illian in dieser Schlacht beistehen und den Angriff zurückschlagen.

TEXT.English: Outside of the defenders the Grigori capital is abandoned. Your men do discover two priests that had been held in the Grigori dungeon. They send the priests to your capital, where they pledge their loyalty to you.
TEXT.German: Außer den Verteidigern befindet sich niemand in der Hauptstadt der Grigori. Allerdings finden Eure Männer doch noch 2 Priester, die im Verlies der Grigori gefangen gehalten wurden. Die Priester werden in Eure Hauptstadt geschickt, wo sie Euch Treue schwören.

TEXT.English: Runners have already escaped to warn the Bannor empire of their loss. But Tethira stands defiantly with the last of the city's defenders within his palace. They offer satisfying screams as you light the building on fire. Your military victory inspires your troops, increasing their experience.
TEXT.German: Während Eure Armee die bannorische Hauptstadt einnimmt, ist Capria längst geflohen. Ihr letztes Aufgebot verschanzt sich im Palast und gibt befriedigende Schreie von sich, als Ihr das Gebäude anzündet. Euer militärischer Sieg beflügelt Eure Truppen und steigert ihre Erfahrung.

TEXT.English: Tales of your victory over the Elohim boost your influence, spreading your cities' borders as people such to join your empire.
TEXT.German: Geschichten Eures Sieges über die Elohim steigern Euren Einfluss und erweitern die Grenzen Eurer Städte, als immer mehr Leute Eurem Reich beitreten wollen.

TEXT.English: The Illians' homeland has been reclaimed. The Illian elders are grateful for your help and they listen intently to your story of the prophecy. Together you set out to the site of Mulcarn's death, the ruins of Letum Frigus. You arrive just as Illian man walks out of the ruins. He is barely covered but unaffected by the freezing temperature.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am the one you seek, Auric Ulvin, the reborn form of the god of winter. Follow me and this world will belong to us again."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Around you men drop to their knees in worship, Doviello and Illian alike. Could this young man be the god you seek?
TEXT.German: Die Heimat der Illian wurde zurückgewonnen. Die Weisen der Illian sind für Eure Hilfe dankbar und hören Eurer Geschichte und der Prophezeiung aufmerksam zu. Gemeinsam mit ihnen begebt Ihr Euch zu der Stätte von Mulcarns Tod, den Ruinen von Letum Frigus. Als Ihr ankommt, verlässt ein Mann gerade die Ruinen. Er hat nur Fetzen am Leib, aber offenbar spürt er die eisigen Temperaturen nicht.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich bin jener, welchen ihr sucht, Auric Ulvin, der wiedergeborene Gott des Winters. Folgt mir und diese Welt wird wieder uns gehören."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Um Euch herum fallen Männer in Ehrfurcht auf ihre Knie, Doviello und Illian gleichermaßen. Könnte dieser Mann der Gott sein, den Ihr sucht?

TEXT.English: The Black Tower
TEXT.German: Schwarzer Turm

TEXT.English: Description: Tebryn means to destroy the world. He has gathered his generals around him and has bent the power of the Dead Lands to his control. If Armageddon is to be prevented Tebryn must be stopped here.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Human units won't heal in this scenario. Human units that die are reborn as demonic units under Tebryn's control. Tebryn's lands can't be entered until all the other Sheaim players are defeated.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Radiant Guard scenario.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Tebryn hat vor, die Welt zu zerstören. Er hat seine Gneräle um sich versammelt und die Macht des Totenreichs unter seine Kontrolle gebracht. Wenn Armageddon verhindert werden soll, muss Tebryn hier aufgehalten werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Menschliche Einheiten können in diesem Szenario nicht geheilt werden. Menschliche Einheiten, die getötet werden, werden als Dämonen-Einheit unter Tebryns Kontrolle wiedergeboren. Tebryns Reich kann nicht betreten werden, bis nicht alle anderen sheaïmischen Oberhäupter besiegt sind.

TEXT.English: Defeat Averax, Gosea and Malchavic
TEXT.German: Besiegt Averax, Gosea und Malchavic

TEXT.English: Defeat Tebryn
TEXT.German: Besiegt Tebryn

TEXT.English: A hero has joined your army
TEXT.German: Ein Held ist eurer Armee beigetreten

TEXT.English: Rhoanna lay tangled in the sheets. She was as beautiful and fierce as any woman, and a lifetime spent in the saddle had turned last night's passion into an athletic event. Falamar had always felt himself a more than adequate, some had said legendary, lover but Rhoanna was insatiable. Falamar slipped quietly from the bed in the fear that if she awoke she would not let him escape. He felt sudden sympathy for the wild mustangs Rhoanna had ridden until they broke and surrendered to her will.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Up on deck the sea air revived him and he stretched and called for a report from Amergin, and a hot tea from a deck hand.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No rum captain?" the deck hand asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My body aches enough this morning Rory, best to at least keep my mind sharp." Falamar answered, then turning to Amergin he said, "How close are we to the Dead Lands?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We will be upon them by midday. There are already reports that the Sheaim are readying for us, and our advance ship returned during the night crewed by skeletons. We had to sink it ourselves."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar's eyes widened and he called down to Rory in the mess, "on second thought I'll take a bit of rum with that, on the side." Looking back at Amergin he asked, "Anything else?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Dead Lands appear much as our own except at its heart where it's as defiled as Hyborem's own lands. Tebryn has a spell around these lands that keeps anyone from entering without his approval. This spell is maintained by ritualists in the capital of his generals, Averax, Gosea and Malchavic. Until they are destroyed we won't be able to assault Tebryn directly."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rory placed the hot tea and rum at Falamar's side and asked, "Anything else captain?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No, thank you Rory." Falamar quickly drank the rum before asking Amergin to continue.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There are reports that men who die within this region find their souls drawn to the black tower, where they are transformed into hellish versions of themselves, skeletons, wraiths, sect of flies, eidolons and such. I cannot imagine a worse fate for a man's soul, and for us it means that we will face any we lose in battle."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm going to need more rum!" Falamar yelled to Rory, who quickly scrambled to refill Falamar's goblet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Anything else Amergin?" Falamar asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The living seem unable to heal here. Those injured in the battle against the skeleton ship still bleed as if their wounds were fresh. These lands are cursed, and it does not favor us."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar downed the second rum, "And what of the rum?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We are well stocked captain."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Lock away my enemy in an unassailable location, subject me to the threat of eternal damnation as some wretched bone pile, remove from me even the tiny gifts of health and healing, but leave the rum."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Aye captain." Amergin grinned, a rare sight on the first mate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You had best rouse our guest and tell her everything you have told me. We will need all the strength we have by midday."

There was a celebration that would make Perpentach himself jealous. When Tebryn died the black tower collapsed around him. Many wondered if he survived the attack until they noticed that the corruption of the land began to heal, as did the injured men. Everywhere men of various nations drank, sung and for the first time in months, relaxed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar grabbed a bottle of rare Svartalfar wine and went to find Rhoanna. The war kept them both so busy that he hadn't seen her for weeks, and he found himself almost as excited to see her as he was to defeat the Sheaim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He found her in a small group of her captains along with a Hippus messenger that Falamar didn't recognize. Expecting cheers from the group Falamar stopped when he noticed they spoke in hushed somber tones, even while the rest of the army celebrated around them. Even Rhoanna's dark eyes were swollen and red; she had been crying. But there were no tears now, only anger and determination.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Is everything alright?" Falamar asked. He set the wine down as it felt inappropriate to stand there dumbly holding it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The captains quieted, they saluted Falamar but didn't answer the question. Rhoanna gave Falamar a weary smile, she was happy to see him and felt somehow relieved to have him close despite the recent news.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Tasunke is the head of the Aroul-Hippi, the most powerful Hippus clan. He is, he was, as close as we have to a king."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She paused here. Falamar knew who Tasunke was, she had spoken frequently of him with both frustration and admiration. But even outside of Rhoanna's tales there weren't many in Erebus who hadn't heard of the mercenary king of the Hippus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Illians are rising in the north." Rhoanna continued, "and they had hired Tasunke to fight for them. When they were finished with him, they killed him and turned on the Aroul-Hippi. There are a fragile few that were able to escape the purge. Altheriol-ta-Mealthiel is gone, our people are slaughtered and the only armies that remain are those that fought here."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar sat down beside Rhoanna. The captains' faces were stern but it was obvious they had been arguing the next steps. Despite their great respect for Falamar, they considered this a Hippus matter and weren't willing to involve him unless Rhoanna did. But Falamar could guess the points of the argument, some of them wanted to seek revenge and attack the Illians and others wanted to withdrawal into lands that were safe and rebuild.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The fate of the Hippus and Lanun are intertwined. You have our strength and friendship if you desire it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Even if we sail against the Illians?" Rhoanna asked, "We have reports that their leader means to resurrect the god of winter and cast us into eternal winter. They prepare now for the ritual. Would you be so quick to jump from the fires of the Sheaim into the freezing winds of the Illians?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar thought about it. He hadn't expected another war, and knew his men had more than earned their rest. They would be remembered for generations for what they had accomplished here. How could he ask them to exchange that for another desperate war?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna knew he would join her when she saw his crooked smile.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That depends," Falamar asked, "would we get to share a flagship again?"
The Cult
TEXT.German: Der Kult

TEXT.English: Description: Auric seeks Pristin Pass, the legendary resting places of the war machines of the gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: This scenario features a dungeon area that has to be conquered to successfully complete it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Beneath the Heel scenario.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Auric begehrt den Pristinpass, den legendären Lagerplatz der Kriegsmaschinen der Götter.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Diese Szenario beinhaltet einen Dungeon, der erobert werden muss, um das Szenario erfolgreich zu beenden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Mulcarns Wiedergeburt".

TEXT.English: Find the pass under the mountains
TEXT.German: Findet den Pass unter den Bergen

TEXT.English: Pass through the dungeon to Pristin Pass
TEXT.German: Durchquert den Dungeon, um zum Pristinpass zu kommen

TEXT.English: Defeat the Sheaim and the Kuriotates
TEXT.German: Besiegt die Sheaïm und die Kuriotaten

TEXT.English: Piles of maps covered the table. Where a god once stood there was now topographic drawings, mana charts and heat summaries from various areas. Tasunke couldn't understand any of them. He was skilled at reading the terrain, troop movement and defensive fortifications, but these maps were a collection of obscure and what seemed to him to be irrelevant data. The priests of winter didn't agree.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They were commanding the army now. Auric had withdrawn to his tent, leaving Lucian and Tasunke to deal with the priests. Tasunke didn't like dealing with underlings, and their search for a valley that didn't exist didn't inspire much confidence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tasunke left the meeting room. The camp was a mix of the three armies. The Doviello were too restless to make good neighbors and kept mostly to themselves, while the Hippus and Illians shared guard patrols, wine and stories. Tasunke crossed to the center of the camp where Auric's tent stood, Lucian had to sleep sometime and he wasn't on his usual station outside the tent. There were currently Hippus soldiers on guard and they didn't stand in Tasunke's way.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The inside of the tent was pitch black and so cold Tasunke stopped in surprise. Unable to see anything he considered going back through the thick curtains of the tent's entrance, but he steeled himself and continued into the tent, although slower.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Lord Auric? It is Tasunke, I've come to inquire on your orders for the Hippus."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric opened his eyes and the room was bathed in blue and white light. Darkness wrestled with the blue fire and the room flickered with dancing shapes. There were armies in those shapes, battles being fought, the ruins of great cities and creatures dark and powerful. Auric sat at its center, pale skin dripping with sweat that turned to ice in the freezing room. He opened his mouth to speak but no words came out.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tasunke placed his hand on the hilt of his sword, this was no man, but a beast possessed of something far greater than himself. At first he thought to protect himself from whatever Auric had become, but then he thought that it may be an act of mercy to kill Auric and save him from this torture. But when Auric lurched forward Tasunke stepped back in fear.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Pristin Pass."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The words were mouthed by Auric but resonated through the tent from hundreds of different voices.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There is only one entrance, and you must go under the mountains to reach it. Beware for it is already contested ground. We will have to clear the valley if we are to claim it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric's skin paled as he spoke, then flushed nearly black as he looked at Tasunke. Tasunke nodded slowly at the strange abomination before responding.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I will tell the priests your orders... Is there anything else you would wish from your army or the Hippus?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric coughed, a ragged inhuman sound that tore through him and caused him to spit wet buttery pieces of flesh out onto the floor. He wiped his mouth with his sleeve.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Do not bother me again, warn your men to guard me better and soon you will offer invaluable service to the god of winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the dancing shadows of the rooms walls a dragon rose up and roared. Then Auric closed his eyes and the room fell back into silent darkness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tasunke felt his way out of the tent. Outside the sunlight brought welcome relief. But where his guards once stood, there were now only the frozen husks of bodies. Tasunke assigned new guards to the post, warning them to keep everyone out, then rushed to the priests to deliver Auric's message.

Auric led the generals down into the dragon's chamber. Ice mana in the caverns wall bathed the chamber in pale blue light. The center of the chamber looked to have once been an underground lake, now frozen. Snow covered the surface and the remains of a dragon's skeleton was trapped in the ice.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric looked more human than he had when Tasunke entered his tent, though it was only through considerable effort that he was able to appear so. His sleeves were brown with dried blood and his skin glistened with moisture. Since the incident in the tent Tasunke copied Lucian's behavior and only stood quietly and didn't question the dragonless chamber.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric walked out onto the ice. Reaching the nose of the dragon skeleton he whispered into what may have once been the creature's ear. Tasunke risked a glance at Lucian, to see how he was reacting to their prize of a giant dragon corpse. But if Lucian was disappointed, or surprised at all, he didn't show it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then another ragged inhuman cough tore through Auric. He steadied himself on the giant skull and once he recovered he leaned in close and blew into the creature's mouth. Auric's breath was white with frost and it seemed to grow as it moved through the skeleton. It stuck to the bones like snow and from it grew muscles and flesh. As the group watched Drifa was reborn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The dragon began to shift as her muscles grew. Still half skeleton Drifa lifted herself from the frozen lake, breaking the ice that held her and unfurling her wings. By the time she had shaken herself free of the lake she was fully formed of scales, teeth and thick muscles. Drifa leaned down and glared at Auric with perfect blue eyes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who are you to awake me so?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am your god, I am the resurrection of Mulcarn. And I am one step away from becoming the god of winter. You will serve me as you served him."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Drifa narrowed her eyes and studied Auric closely.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"To long have I slumbered, but I have a taste for the flesh of kings and though you may one day be a god, you are a king now. If you wish my service, you must sacrifice a king to me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric nodded, unsurprised. He turned to leave the chamber, pausing only to whisper to Tasunke.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It is your time to serve the god of winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The last thing Tasunke saw was Drifa rising up over him.
The Momus
TEXT.German: Der Momus

TEXT.English: It's no fun if only some play[NEWLINE]I know a better way[NEWLINE]If everyone tries[NEWLINE]To make sure everyone dies[NEWLINE]We'll have a more interesting day
I've fallen so far from my home and I'm cursed to be buried in these crazed lands. I would have done better to fall on the horseman's spear than in his cage.
TEXT.German: Ich bin gefallen, so weit weg von meiner Heimat. Und ich bin verflucht, dass ich in diesen verrückten Landen begraben werde. Mir wäre es besser ergangen, wenn ich in den Speer des Reiters gestürzt wäre, anstatt in seinen Käfig.

TEXT.English: I hear... a sweet voice whispering to me. It welcomes your blade, come and drink of it with me.
TEXT.German: Ich höre... eine süße Stimme, die mir zuflüstert. Sie heißt Euer Schwert willkommen. Kommt und trinkt mit mir auf sie.

TEXT.English: This is not true battle, I cannot savor wars declared and then canceled on a whim.
TEXT.German: Das ist kein richtiger Kampf. Ich kann Kriege nicht genießen, die aus einer Laune heraus erst erklärt und dann einfach beendet werden.

TEXT.English: When I am gone will you attach strings to my body and play with me too?
TEXT.German: Wenn ich fort bin, werdet ihr dann Schnüre an meinem Körper anbringen und auch mit mir spielen?

TEXT.English: I'd gladly stay and win this contest, but I have other duties to attend to.
TEXT.German: Ich würde gerne bleiben, um diesen Wettkampf zu gewinnen, aber mich erwarten noch andere Verpflichtungen.

TEXT.English: This is another test I've failed, though at least this time only my life is lost.
TEXT.German: Dies ist eine weitere Prüfung, in der ich versagt habe. Allerdings ist dieses Mal zumindest nur mein Leben verloren.

TEXT.English: The prize would have made me as renown as Tasunke himself, but we were too slow.
TEXT.German: Die Belohnung hätte mich ebenso bekannt gemacht wie Tasuke selbst, aber wir waren zu langsam.

TEXT.English: I hate losing. Do you know how many people I'm going to have to kill before I start feeling better?
TEXT.German: Ich hasse es zu verlieren. Wisst ihr überhaupt, wieviele Leute ich töten muss, bevor ich wieder anfange, mich besser zu fühlen?

TEXT.English: Description: Perpentach holds a contest between various warlords and the winner receives a great reward from the clown king. The others rarely survive.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Perpentach controls all declarations of warfare in the game, and changes them based on his whims. He may order everyone to dogpile one opponent, or declare that everyone should fight everyone.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Grand Menagerie scenario.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Perpentach veranstaltet einen Wettbewerb zwischen verschiedenen Kriegsherren und der Sieger erhält vom Clownkönig eine große Belohnung. Die anderen überleben selten.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Perpentach hat in dieser Partie Kontrolle über alle Kriegserklärungen und spricht sie je nach Lust und Laune aus. Er könnte allen befehlen, sich auf einen Gegner zu stürzen, oder verkünden, dass jeder gegen jeden kämpfen soll.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Die Strahlende Wache".

TEXT.English: You'd claim he was just a boy[NEWLINE]But he makes the most fabulous toys[NEWLINE]From granite or jade[NEWLINE]His creations are made[NEWLINE]Go take some and share in his joy
The Lanun are far too few[NEWLINE]What's our Falamar to do?[NEWLINE]But take his men[NEWLINE]And try to win[NEWLINE]Some ships that he can crew
Furia our beautiful queen[NEWLINE]The most lovely I've ever seen[NEWLINE]But mad as... well me[NEWLINE]And never happy to see[NEWLINE]Her reflection, which makes her quite mean
I don't think he enjoys our jests[NEWLINE]Because of that I think that it's best[NEWLINE]That you all do away[NEWLINE]With the butcher today[NEWLINE]And put him to his eternal rest

Dolls decorated Melisandre's bed[NEWLINE]"Throw them away," her parents said[NEWLINE]"You're too old for those anymore"[NEWLINE]But the dolls came across the floor[NEWLINE]And threw the parents out instead
Duke Sallos has come to our play[NEWLINE]I'm honored he'd come all this way[NEWLINE]To make sure he has fun[NEWLINE]Let's get everyone[NEWLINE]To engage his troops in melee
Candle, candle burning bright[NEWLINE]Tya entered the cave of the Amurites[NEWLINE]Together tested no one knew[NEWLINE]A child inside her body grew[NEWLINE]Now she's all alone at night
Uldanor comes seeking our prize[NEWLINE]I don't want to spoil the surprise[NEWLINE]But he'll be very pleased[NEWLINE]With the prize if he's[NEWLINE]Not the one who dies
Weevil, Pickle and Hyde[NEWLINE]No matter how much I've tried[NEWLINE]Chop, maim and dismember[NEWLINE]Bored audience members[NEWLINE]I think it's time that they died
Defeat all players except Perpentach
TEXT.German: Besiegt alle Gegner außer Perpentach

TEXT.English: "Falamar."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There was nothing but darkness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Falamar."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I twisted in my dreams. I still imagined the tentacle around my leg through the veil of fear and emptiness. I drifted toward eternal sleep, but something wouldn't let me go.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Falamar."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I opened my eyes and there was water all around, a world without earth or sky. I floated weightless in the current, forever falling in the seas caress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There was another above me, a woman, but as inhuman as she was beautiful. She was the tide, powerful but yielding, fleeting but eternal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who are you?" I asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am Condatis, the archangel of Danalin, God of the Sea."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Afraid, I tried to swim away from her. I wasn't religious but I had seen enough temples and asylums of those that worshiped Danalin to suspect that this wasn't the afterlife I intended. Even if it did feature floating billowy maidens.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Danalin? As in the overlords? Is this the heaven for cultists and zealots?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She looked hurt. There was pain in her eyes, and love. I regretted my words.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No." she replied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Oh... are you my reward?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No!" she said, this time there was anger in her eyes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I seemed to be getting this all wrong so I just floated silently and let her speak.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I led you to Keelyn so that she would take you to her father, but Hastur predicts my actions. An archmage, Tebryn Arbandi, means to destroy creation. Go to the Momus, convince him to supply you with a fleet then sail through the Arduro Straight to the Dead Lands. Defeat Tebryn so I have time to defeat Hastur."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You sure you don't want Capria, or that guy that killed Mulcarn? I'm more of a steal-the-king's-galleon kind of hero."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She smiled, "My young prince, we must all make do with what we have."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The water rippled and her face was replaced with the bearded face of Amergin. He was pulling me up on the beach.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Falamar, are you okay?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm okay," I stammered through racking coughs, "how are the men?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Some are fine, others haven't been recovered yet."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I understood his meaning and picked myself up. After recovering far too few of my men from the sea we went to meet with Perpentach. He ignored the threat of Tebryn and my pleas for help. But he was holding a competition between warlords, and he promised to supply the navy I required if I won. With few men and no ships, we had little choice but to enter.

Jubilee was in ruins. It was impossible to tell the difference between the Balseraph warriors and their citizens. A muscle-bound man would sit and drink solemnly while a foppish dandy or woman would attack with a club, sword or bare fists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar ordered his men to leave the innocents alone and strike only in defense. Enough people had already died and these people were just another set of victims to Perpentach's madness. Falamar just wanted to take their ships and sail away from the Cliffs of Hastur.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Beeri stopped Falamar as they neared the docks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Those flags aren't Balseraph. The remnants of Uldanor's army look to be holding the docks, with reinforcements judging by the number of them."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Beeri was right. A long line of well outfitted Hippus troops stood along the docks, weapons at the ready. They held all the ships captive, including the warships Falamar meant to use to sail to the Dead Lands.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Lanun and Hippus met on the docks and eyed each other warily. When Uldanor pushed his way to the Hippus front Beeri called out to him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We earned Perpentach's fleet on the battlefield, we won't have you swoop in and steal it now. Are you ready to receive another beating trying?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Beeri held a grudge against the Hippus for his treatment at Tasunke's hands. Falamar was both shocked and amused by the Luchuirp's words, and had to steel himself to keep from laughing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If you wish a deal you must make it with me," a woman's voice shouted.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The call came from the bow of a Hippus galleon where a beautiful armored woman with long golden hair stood.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I see you got your ship back." Falamar called.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna looked surprised, then narrowed her eyes in mock anger. "No thanks to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That was, I'll remind you, my brother-in-law's fault. I simply offered a ride to a lady in distress."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"For a price," she returned.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Well, I didn't want you to feel beholden to me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She huffed and signaled for Falamar to come onboard.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Beeri whispered "Don't trust them, there as likely to cage you like a wild boar as to hold their word."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar nodded and crossed through the Hippus lines and up onto the ship's deck.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You look lovely, command of an army suits you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And you as well, I didn't think pirates lead armies," she replied. "I need these warships to transport my men."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am taking these warships to the Dead Lands," Falamar answered. "I have my own war to wage."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You won't get to the Dead Lands. The straight is overrun with devils. And no significant army can move through there. But..." and at this she smiled, "the Empyrean has hired us to join the Radiant Guard and defend Bourne the Gleaming from Hyborem's attack. If we can hold long enough for Basium to arrive the devils can be removed from the straight and you can sail through."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"So you want to hire me to transport your army to Bourne?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We may be able to pay something. But as far as I can tell you need us as much as we need you," again she smiled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Maybe," Falamar answered, "I will attack the Sheaim in the Dead Lands. There is no gold to be made there, but they mean to corrupt the world itself. If I help you in the straight, will you sail with me to the Dead Lands and join me against the Sheaim?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes," she said after a pause, "but we share the flagship."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I would be honored to have you."

Perpentach looked confused. His advisor whispered, rather loudly, that we had won his contest but he didn't seem to understand. I finally interrupted.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You promised us a navy, to stop the Sheaim from destroying the world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Many men have tried," he answered, still unsure. He looked closely at me, as if he didn't recognize me though we met many times during the contest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, but that was our deal. That you provide the ships to sail us through the Aduro Straight and into the Dead Lands."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Haven't enough Lanun died?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I ignored his question. Too many had died, especially in his brutal games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Are you giving us the ships or not?" I asked. My men tensed behind me and mentally I reviewed each of the Balseraph guards we had seen since entering the palace. If we had to fight our way out while dragging Perpentach out by his pointy hat we would.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes indeed, it's only fair that I help to get you there. I'll give you ships though you're not done, you won't see them 'til another's won."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Not wanting to risk another bout of amnesia I simply thanked him and we headed to the docks to claim our ships. As difficult as he had been to deal with we could not question the quality of the ships he supplied. They were fully outfitted, and although a bit garishly colored, were both comfortable and suitable for battle.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As we boarded I noticed Uldanor boarding a ship that was flying Hippus colors. It looked familiar so I headed down to meet the captain. Seeing her aboard I called up to her from the docks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I see you got your ship back."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna looked surprised, then narrowed her eyes in mock anger. "No thanks to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That was, I'll remind you, my brother-in-law's fault. I simply offered a ride to a lady in distress."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"For a price," she returned.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Well, I didn't want you to feel beholden to me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She huffed then, glancing over at the warships raising the Lanun flag, invited me onboard. Uldanor glared at me but I had only saved him the humiliation of being beaten by those deranged midgets. Still, it seemed a poor time to bring it up so I simply nodded towards him and walked over to where Rhoanna stood issuing orders to her crew.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You seem in a hurry to set off," I pointed out. "Jubilee is supposed to hold an amazing festival after each contest, it would be a shame to miss it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Satisfied that her crew was working she leaned against the railing and looked at me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have no time for festivals," she replied. "I have an army to transport and you seem to control the warships we were planning to do it with."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They were packing men and weapons as close as they could in the hold and the ship was already sitting unusually low in the water. These are the signs I was used to looking for in rich marks ripe with plunder. Despite the load there was still considerable stocks, weapons and Hippus soldiers waiting on the dock.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am taking these warships to the Dead Lands," I answered. "I have my own war to wage."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You won't get to the Dead Lands. The straight is overrun with devils. And no significant army can move through there. But..." and at this she smiled, "the Empyrean has hired us to join the Radiant Guard and defend Bourne the Gleaming from Hyborem's attack. If we can hold long enough for Basium to arrive the devils can be removed from the straight and you can sail through."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"So you want to hire me to transport your army to Bourne?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We may be able to pay something. But as far as I can tell you need us as much as we need you," again she smiled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Maybe," I answered, "I will attack the Sheaim in the Dead Lands. There is no gold to be made there, but they mean to corrupt the world itself. If I help you in the straight, will you sail with me to the Dead Lands and join me against the Sheaim?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes," she said after a pause, "if I can do so from your flagship instead of this overloaded bucket."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I would be honored to have you."
The Radiant Guard
TEXT.German: Die Strahlende Wache

TEXT.English: We sail for the Fane of Lessers to assault the Throne of Hell itself. But the infernal city of Bastradam stands in our way. If you capture the city we will aide you in your war in the Dead Lands.
TEXT.German: Wir sind auf dem Weg zum Tempel der Unbedeutenden, um den Höllenthron selbst anzugreifen. Aber die infernalische Stadt Bastradam steht uns im Weg. Wenn Ihr die Stadt erobert, werden wir Euch bei Eurem Krieg im Totenreich unterstützen.

TEXT.English: We cannot wait indefinitely, capture Bastradam within the next 20 turns if we are to help you.
TEXT.German: Wir können nicht ewig warten. Erobert Bastradam innerhalb der nächsten 20 Runden, wenn wir Euch helfen sollen.

TEXT.English: Tarry no longer, capture Bastradam within the next 10 turns or we will be forced to turn back.
TEXT.German: Zögert nicht länger. Erobert Bastradam innerhalb der nächsten 10 Runden oder wir werden gezwungen sein umzukehren.

TEXT.English: I cannot wait any longer, we must return to Torrolerial. You will have to assail the Dead Lands without the aide of the Bannor.
TEXT.German: Ich kann nicht länger warten. Wir müssen zurück nach Torrolerial. Ihr werdet das Totenreich ohne die Hilfe der Bannor erstürmen müssen.

TEXT.English: Though blood fades and bones become dust, may your spirit remain strong. And as long as it does the Bannor will stand beside you. We will meet you in the Dead Lands. For now, take these men to aide your cause. But beware for faithful Sabathiel told of stories of Basium, and he is unbound by mortal virtues.
TEXT.German: Auch wenn Blut vergeht und Knochen zu Staub werden, soll Euer Geist stark bleiben. Und solange er das ist, werden die Bannor an Eurer Seite stehen. Wir sehen uns im Totenreich. Nehmt fürs Erste diese Männer, die Euch bei Eurer Sache unterstützen sollen. Aber hütet Euch, denn der treue Sabathiel erzählte uns Geschichten über Basium, der nicht an sterbliche Werte gebunden ist.

TEXT.English: Description: Protect the citizens of Bourne the Gleaming until they complete the Mercurian Gate. Kill 100 Infernal units before any attack Bourne to win.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Player cannot go farther west than the starting location. The Infernal receive free units in their cities every turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Momus scenario.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Beschützt die Bewohner von Bourne der Strahlenden, bis sie das Tor der Mercurianer vollendet haben. Tötet 100 Einheiten der Infernalen, bevor diese Bourne angreifen, um dieses Szenario erfolgreich zu beenden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Einheiten können nicht weiter westlich bewegt werden als die Startposition. Die Infernalen erhalten in ihren Städten jede Runde kostenlose Einheiten.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Der Schwarze Turm".

TEXT.English: %d1 enemies left to kill
TEXT.German: %d1 [NUM1:Feind:Feinde] übrig

TEXT.English: Defeat Basium!
TEXT.German: Besiegt Basium!

TEXT.English: Defeat Hyborem!
TEXT.German: Besiegt Hyborem!

TEXT.English: Rhoanna spoke to the unit commander in hushed tones. He wore the same golden armor as his men, but had passed through a few more winters, and his authority was obvious from the respect his men showed him. Falamar noticed that black tattoos snaked up from under his armor and wrapped around his neck and his left hand was covered with intricate tattoos, which was highly unusual for a commander of the Radiant Guard. He also looked pained, stressed beyond even the ravages of war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna walked back to where Falamar and the crew waited.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He says Bourne is threatened from internal and external forces. He wants us to lead the troops in the field, to keep the Infernals from attacking Bourne while they fight the heretics inside the city."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar walked close enough that they could talk without anyone overhearing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who is the commander? He looks afraid of more than death."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna glanced back at the commander who was in the process of splitting his men, some to return to the city and other to stay and await orders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"His name is Mikel, he's the son of an Emry," she answered. "He grew up among the Sheaim before splitting and dedicating his life to the Empyrean."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That explains the tattoos. But that should make him less afraid of war."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The heretics have captured his wife and three-year-old daughter. They demanded he take his men and abandon the city and he has refused. There isn't much hope he will be able to save them."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She said this last part softly, but Mikel was behind her and had heard it. If the words affected him he didn't show it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am the shield until the sword comes free," he intoned. "If you hold the line here I will scourge the heretics form Bourne and Basium will have a base to launch his war from. If the Infernals slip through your line then Bourne will fall and the devils will consume this land. I will give you some of the guard to stand with you. Will you battle Hyborem?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes," Falamar answered without hesitation, "take care of Bourne and leave the devils to us."

Verchiel dropped to his knees and cried. He was an angel of Lugus, lord of the dawn and revelation, but he was unable to deliver his message. He knew where Mikel's wife and daughter were imprisoned, Verchiel was kneeling beside them in the ether. But Mikel was too full of fear and doubt to hear the angel's voice. The city's priests either didn't understand the message or were too busy praising the victory against the Infernals. Even now the heretics sat in the barrack's main hall planning to kill their two prisoners and dump the bodies into the sewers. They were only one floor above them and after weeks of being held within the barracks, the prisoners only had a few minutes left to live.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Why are you crying?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Verchiel stopped in surprise. He looked up to see Meegan, Mikel's three year old daughter looking at him quizzically.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Can you see me child?" Verchiel asked, equally puzzled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Of course. What is your name?" she asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hallah, Meegan's mother, sat staring at the iron-bound door of the cell as she had for weeks. The room they were trapped in was an old storage room, and still had a pile of old tools and supplies in it. She had been through it a dozen times but there was nothing that could help her escape. She tried to stay strong while Meegan was awake, and save her tears for when her daughter was sleeping. She was so lost in her thoughts it took her a minute to realize Meegan was holding a conversation with an old broom.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Chipmunk, who are you talking to?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Meegan smiled, "His name is Verchiel, he's an angel and he will help us get back to daddy."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hallah had no words. At three years old her daughter had gone crazy. Hallah wasn't sure if she should be jealous of her daughter's hope, or condemn her for it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We need something shiny," Meegan said, going again through the pile of supplies. She finally found an old copper plate that seemed to satisfy her and she cleaned it as well as possible with the hem of her dress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hallah heard the door to the basement open. This time instead of the single footsteps of someone bringing them food she heard a group coming down the stairs. Hallah pulled Meegan into her arms and when she squirmed Hallah told her to be quiet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There was a jingle of keys and then the door opened. Six men, all of the conspirators were here. Two had swords drawn, one a knife and another had a rope he looked about to put to use.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Sorry deary," he said, "your husband's too stubborn for his own good."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At that Meegan tore free of her mothers grip and stood protectively in front of her. She held the polished copper plate above her head and the men stepped back a bit at the sudden move. Nothing happened.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then Meegan asked the broom, "what do I say?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Come on deary," the man carrying the rope said, "ain't no joy in killing a child. But it's either you go into the sewers or I go into the dungeon, and I ain't fool enough to consider that."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You cannot hide your actions," Meegan shouted in a voice half her own and half unworldly, "Lugus will reveal all. If you mean to escape, then flee now into the darkness; this area has been claimed by the rose of summer!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hallah was more surprised than the men and they took a stunned step backwards. But realizing that no matter the threat they weren't about to be cowed by a three-year-old with an old plate, one of the swordsmen stepped towards Meegan.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The copper plate exploded in light. It was as if Meegan held the sun itself above her head. The men covered their eyes in pain, light flooded the storage room, the hallway and up into the barracks itself. Breaking free of every window or crack in the barracks walls light came spilling out onto the dark streets of Bourne. The Radiant Guard knew immediately that the power of Lugus was manifest within the city and rushed toward the barracks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One of the kidnappers yelled for his men to stand firm. The light burnt through to his eyes even when they were closed and covered by his arm. He placed his sword in front of him and risked one peek at where he thought the little girl was standing. When he looked he saw a golden angel standing before him with a blazing sword.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You will not harm these people," the angel said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The heretics fled up out of the barracks and into the street where they were met by the radiant guard and quickly arrested. Mikel was just starting to question one when his wife and daughter stepped out of the barracks. If there is any true hope or happiness left in Erebus, it existed there as Mikel swept them both up into his arms. It was hours before he let go of either of them.

The savant examined Mikel. Mikel was tied to a post that had been erected behind a small granary. The Infernals had several people tied up within the city and refused to kill anyone yet, and they wanted to make sure none of the prisoners could see each other, so each was alone. But they could hear each other in pain and agony. It was worse to imagine what was happening to the others than to actually see it. Especially with the horrifying demons that now walked the streets of Bourne. Except for being tied up Mikel had been left alone, but apparently it was his turn now.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A few members of the Sect of Flies came into the yard. They were decrepit and foul. They were named for the thousands of flies that lived on and about them, but worse parasites lived and feasted in their flesh. Their skin crawled with the pressure of the creatures that burrowed within it and their stench was like sweat and rotten flesh, as if a corpse had gone for a long jog.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Mikel wasn't afraid. He had seen horrible things when he lived among the Sheaim and he had already accepted that he was to die here. He prayed to Lugus for the purification of his soul, for forgiveness for his own weakness in being unable to protect the city, and for the souls of his wife and daughter who had been taken from him weeks ago. He was not afraid until he saw who they dragged out into the yard.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was his wife Hallah. She was still alive, but beaten and bruised. They hadn't killed her, for a moment he was grateful for that, until he realized what they had saved her for.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Sect of Flies started by pulling off her clothes. She screamed and looked at Mikel in terror and shame as they debased themselves upon her. Their parasites fed on her as well, and they spread through any placed they touched. For hours they abused her in increasingly painful ways until finally her spirit was broken and she just lay quiet as they acted out their desires upon her. In time the burrowing parasites could be seen under her flesh and her body twitched and spasmed to the pain of being consumed from the inside out.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]By the time Hallah died Mikel had no prayers left in him. He had threatened, screamed, cried and finally begged for it to stop but the devils had ignored all of it. Mikel questioned everything in his life that lead him to this moment, was sorry for every decision. And that was before they brought out his daughter. By the time that torment was done the only thing left within Mikel was pain and hatred.
The Splintered Court
TEXT.German: Die entzweiten Höfe

TEXT.English: The Ljosalfar palace burns, but Arendel has escaped to the cities of her generals. Apparently there is still some fight left in the Summer Queen.
TEXT.German: Der Palast der Ljosalfar brennt, aber Arendel ist zu den Städten ihrer Generäle entkommen. Anscheinend ist in der Sommerkönigin noch etwas Kampfeswille übrig.

TEXT.English: Your army captures the Svartalfar palace. Faeryl stands alone in her gardens. It isn't until she is brought to you that you find that she is just an illusion. The real Faeryl has retreated to the cities of her allies.
TEXT.German: Eure Armeen erobern den Palast der Svartalfar. Faeryl steht allein in ihren Gärten. Bis sie zu Euch gebracht wird, bemerkt niemand, dass sie nur eine Illusion ist. Die echte Faeryl hat sich in die Städte ihrer Feinde zurückgezogen.

TEXT.English: Description: The first summer in over 400 years finds the Svartalfar and the Ljosalfar returning to their ancient home to rekindle their civil war. You fight the battle to see what elven nation will survive in the Age of rebirth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Each turn is represented by one of 8 day cycles: Dawn, Morning, Noon, Afternoon, etc. Different events trigger on different turns. Baron Duin's forces turn into werewolves every dusk and back to men at dawn. The vampires of the Calabim are weak during daylight turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Players cannot build settlers in this scenario. Instead they will occasionally receive immigrants to their cities which the player can outfit as a variety of units for enough gold.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Der erste Sommer nach über 400 Jahren erblickt die Svartalfar und die Ljosalfar, wie sie zu ihrer alten Heimat zurückkehren, um ihren Bürgerkrieg wiederaufleben zu lassen. Ihr führt diesen Kampf, um zu sehen, welche Elfennation das Zeitalter der Wiedergeburt überleben wird.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Jede Runde wird von einer von 8 Tageszeiten bestimmt: Morgendämmerung, Morgen, Mittag, Nachmittag usw. Verschiedene Ereignisse finden nur zu bestimmten Tageszeiten statt. Baron Duins Einheiten verwandeln sich in der Abenddämmerung in Werwölfe und in der Morgendämmerung wieder zurück in Menschen. Die Vampire der Calabim sind während der Runden mit Tageslicht schwach.[NEWLINE]In diesem Szenario können keine Siedler aufgestellt werden. Stattdessen werden gelegentlich Einwanderer in den Städten der Spieler erscheinen, die mit ausreichend Gold zu verschiedenen Einheiten aufgewertet werden können.

TEXT.English: When Sucellus withdrew from Erebus his children were left to rule themselves. They decreed that they would be ruled by two queens, each for half of the year. One queen ruled the summer court and under her the elves nurtured beauty and art, and trained in the vigilant defense of their empire. The other queen ruled the winter court which was made up of the mischievous members of the fey kingdom, the tricksters, illusionists and those fond of laughter and nights spent dancing under the stars. It continued like this all through the Age of Magic, the elven empire grew and revered Sucellus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That lasted until the god of Winter entered creation and dropped Erebus into an unending winter. Faeryl, queen of the winter court, refused to abandon her throne for as long as winter remained. The elves prayed for help and Sucellus answered, coming personally into creation to battle the god of winter. But Sucellus was killed in that battle and his children were left alone and godless.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Faeryl ordered that the worship of a dead god was useless and that the empire should instead revere Esus, the god of night and deception. The shrines of Sucellus were torn down, the priests unwilling to abandon their old faith were rejected from the elven nation. But the summer court rallied against this. Under Arendel, queen of the summer court, they raised an army and attacked the members of the winter court dropping the elves into a bloody civil war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As the world continued to cool from the presence of Mulcarn and the death of Sucellus it became less and less habitable. In time only small isolated pockets remained where the bands of elves could survive. Between the civil war and the cold both sides neared extinction. Eventually the winter made travel and attacks impossible and both sides were forced to put aside their war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Over 400 years later Mulcarn was killed and summer returned. The surviving generations of elves were able to travel again, and they have not forgotten the Umbrawood, their ancient homeland, or the war that has not been settled. Now they meet again within the Umbrawood and this war must be played out to see who will control the elves in this new age.
TEXT.German: Als sich Sucellus von Erebus zurückgezogen hat, waren sich seine Kinder alleine überlassen. Sie verfügten, dass sie von zwei Königinnen beherrscht werden, jede für jeweils ein halbes Jahr. Eine Königin beherrschte den Fürstenhof des Sommers und unter ihr pflegten die Elfen die Schönheit und die Künste, und schulten sich in der wachsamen Verteidigung ihres Reiches. Die andere Köngigin herrschte über den Fürstenhof des Winters, welcher gemacht war für die bösartigen Bewohner des entrückten Königreiches, die Schwindler, Illusionisten und die törrichten Lacher und Tänzer nachts unter dem Sternenhimmel. Dies bestand durch das ganze Zeitalter der Magie, das elfische Königreich wuchs und verehrte Sucellus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Es bestand bis der Gott des Winters die Schöpfung betrat und Erebus in den unendlichen Winter warf. Faeryl, Königin des winterlichen Fürstenhofes, weigerte sich die Herrschaft vor Ende des Winters abzutreten. Die Elfen beteten um Hilfe und Sucellus antwortete, er stieg persönlich herab in die Schöpfung, um den Gott des Winters zu bekämpfen. Aber Sucellus wurde im Kampf getötet und seine Kinder wurden alleine und gottlos zurückgelassen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Faeryl verfügte, dass die Anbetung eines toten Gottes sinnlos sei, und dass im Königreich stattdessen Esus gehuldigt werden sollte, dem Gott der Nacht und der Täuschung. Die Schreine des Sucellus wurden niedergerissen, die Priester die sich weigerten, ihren alten Glauben aufzugeben wurden aus dem elfischen Volk verstossen. Aber der Fürstenhof des Sommers stellte sich dagegen. Unter Arendel, Königin des sommerlichen Fürstenhofes, hoben sie eine Armee aus und griffen die Anhänger des winterlichen Fürstenhofes an - sie warfen die Elfen in einen blutigen Bürgerkrieg.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Als die Welt weiter abkühlte wegen der Anwesenheit von Mulcarn und dem Tod des Sucellus wurde es mehr und mehr lebensfeindlich. Mit der Zeit verblieben nur kleine voneineander abgeschnittene Enklaven, wo die Gruppen der Elfen überleben konnten. Durch den Bürgerkrieg und die Kälte wurden beide Seiten beinahe ausgelöscht. Letztlich machte der Winter Truppenbewegungen und Angriffe unmöglich und beide Seiten wurden gezwungen, ihren Krieg beizulegen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Über 400 Jahre später wurde Mulcarn getötet und der Sommer kehrte zurück. Den überlebenden Generationen der Elfen wurde es wieder ermöglicht zu reisen, und sie hatten weder den Schattenwald nicht vergessen, ihr uraltes Heimatland, noch ihren Krieg, der noch nicht entschieden wurde. Nun treffen sie erneut im Schattenwald aufeinander und dies muss nun ausgespielt werden, wer die Elfen in dieser neuen Ära anführen wird.

TEXT.English: Defeat the Svartalfar
TEXT.German: Besiegt die Svartalfar

TEXT.English: Parith returns from his mission to seek help outside the Umbrawood with a %s1_unit!
Defeat the Ljosalfar
TEXT.German: Besiegt die Ljosalfar

TEXT.English: Faeryl was laid to rest with the honors due an elven queen. Though many argued against a funeral for an enemy leader, Arendel had demanded it. As controversial as it had been no one questioned it now and the massive funeral was properly somber and respectful.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Of the former Svartalfar, all those that had sworn allegiance to the summer court were invited to attend. For the first time in two ages the Svartalfar and Ljosalfar united in a common task, even if it was to mourn the death of the winter queen. They stood up and eulogized her and Svartalfar and Ljosalfar alike shed tears for Faeryl. Even Arendel stood and spoke lovingly of her sister, the fallen queen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That night the funeral procession passed through the streets of Evermore as starlight glistened off of the silver and mithril coffin. As was tradition her coffin was displayed within the Temple of Leaves for the night and then moved to the hidden tomb used to house elven royalty in the morning. By then thousands of gifts were brought to the temple and laid around the tomb.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Just before dawn horns summoned all the citizens of Evermore to the city's grand plaza. Once everyone was gathered Arendel came out onto the palace balcony and addressed them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We must not forget. We must not forget our legends, the days spent within this very wood as the children of Sucellus and Cernunnos. We must not forget that age we spent on our own as a single elven nation and the trials and fortune we shared. And we must not forget that we turned to war with each other."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Every memory we have is shared, every glory, every defeat. We are one people, and we were even as we killed each other."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Long ago, Sucellus anointed two queens to lead us so that the passions of one person could not lead our empire into ruin as happened with the empire of men. But this split led to civil war."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Through prayer and careful deliberation with the priests, sages and captains of both former empires we have decided to form a new high council. That there would be two elven queens and an elven king to lead us. That these leaders would rule year round within their own nations and that they would come together to decide matters for the empire."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I will be the queen of Evermore, of the temples and over the monuments and artifacts of our empire. I will tend to the orchards and provide for the musicians, artists and craftsmen. Brave Amelanchier will be anointed as king and assigned our army, given provision over our forts and made responsible for our defense. He will also take charge of our hunters and be responsible for the lands untended within our borders. Thessa will be anointed as queen and responsible for all manners of study, arcane or mundane, as well as diplomacy and trade with other lands. If military action is to occur outside of our empire then it will be under her leadership."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If you are a child of Sucellus then you are a member of our empire. A particular faith is not a requirement and the former Svartalfar are equal in every way to other citizens. The war is over and if we are to shed tears then we must do so together. If we are angry then we must be angry with ourselves. As mighty Sucellus was destroyed by winter and split apart until Nantosuelta gathered his pieces back together for his resurrection, so are the Ljosalfar. Now rejoined we are reborn, and I pray that will ever be so."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As dawn struck the plaza the Ljosalfar palace seemed to glow with an aura of gold and white. It was a new world for the Ljosalfar and they couldn't help but feel hopeful that it would be a kinder world than they had known for centuries.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That night, after to coronation of Thessa and Amelanchier and seeing them off to their remote capitals Arendel retired to her personal chambers. After checking the magical wards that protected the rooms she removed her amulet and watched in the mirror as the illusion melted away. Her long blond hair shortened to wavy black. Her skin paled to cool alabaster. Her body shifted from the lean beautiful form of the elven queen to her own more sensual and curved body.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Far away, beneath the great red oak of Evermore, within the hidden tomb for elven royalty, behind powerful guards and locked within a silver and mithril box the real Arendel screamed.

The messenger of Esus was one of my favorite creations. He had two mouths and always spoke both the truth and lies. He was currently standing before the court simultaneously telling of the victory of the Svartalfar and of the Ljosalfar. Demonic barons planned both my triumph and a way to recover from this defeat depending on which story they believed. Of course as I am able to discern every lie; it is of no hindrance to me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The messenger addressed the masked figure in the throne, who sat in the deepest shadows of the long hall. Everyone assumed that was Esus, in fact my deception was so complete that even the decoy in the throne believed he was Esus when actually I was disguised as a simple lyrist in the hall. These past few centuries I had begun to wonder: what if everyone in the hall believed that they were Esus and I wasn't in fact the god of deception? But it was a thought I tried to chase out of my mind.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I could see everything done in shadows, hear everything whispered. In a distant cell Ljosalfar prisoners planned for an escape, Rivanna herself considered overthrowing Faeryl, and all throughout the Umbrawood those few elves who remained loyal to Cernunnos hid.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Across the rest of Erebus greater lies are being told by priests, generals and kings. I closed my eyes and buried myself in the layers of manipulation, intrigue and egoism.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But there was one cancerous sore on Erebus, one place devoid of the subtleties of my work. The Dead Lands, where walking corpses spoke their own simple truth and Tebryn Arbandi sought to end my game entirely. There is no opportunity in destruction, and as much as my wayward sister may object, I had no desire to see my kingdoms turned to ash.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]So I whispered into Faeryl's ear. I told her tales of desire, wealth and power and beneath a white moon the Svartalfar launched warships towards the Dead Lands.
Wages of Sin
TEXT.German: Die gerechte Strafe

TEXT.English: Flauros had come to observe the progress Decius was making, and they consulted over dinner. Decius was eating the last stores of an elven city recently conquered, as it was getting harder to find decent food as Hyborem's corruption spread. Flauros merely sipped his imported wine. A fire crackled as they discussed the final battle plans, causing shadows to dance on the castle's walls.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One of the shadows detached itself, however, and dove towards Decius, knives in each hand. One pierced the warrior's side, and he fell from his chair. Flauros watched calmly as Decius rolled aside and removed the knife. The wound wasn't bad, due to his light armor. The assassin lunged again, and Decius barely moved aside. He grabbed the man's arm and swung him into the wall, stunning him with a sickening crunch.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Flauros pushed himself back from the table and rose. "Very well done, my friend. With this invader as well as the entire Tempus Mor gambit. They say the best revenge is living well. I think you've earned the gift. Take this man's dying blood and I will show you the ritual we use to prolong our lives."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius gazed at the cloaked man for a moment, then drew his blade and plunged it into the assassin's heart. Flauros smiled, but Decius cut him off with a "No."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You are refusing the gift?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, I am. If I were to live forever, I might end up like you. Weak and soft."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]His patron replied by picking up the assassin and tearing his head off with his bare hands.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius continued, "You have physical strength, but you take it for granted. The cunning hunter has become the fat and lazy shepherd. Your immortality makes you content to sit back and let the world pass you by. I have walked alongside death and am not ready to abandon him now; I need this foe to keep my reflexes sharp and my plans focused."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Flauros studied Decius for a moment, then replied, "You no longer amuse me. I am returning to Prespur. You may do as you wish with those who will follow you, but do not return to my city on pain of death."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius watched Flauros left, then smiled to himself. He turned to the dead assassin and said, "Now, that's a useful trick you have. Wonder if there are any more like you?"

Ethne stood again in the infirmary. People of many nations lay around her: Elven warriors, Sheaim prisoners of war, Malakim soldiers, religious pilgrims from around the world. Many, many more had passed through here since she had decided to deviate from the Elohim philosophy. A terror had been unleashed, and no doubt her name would be cursed by widows and orphans as Basium took his armies into all lands where the Ashen Veil reached. But her people had been saved, as had a core remnant of her allies. She had regrets, but life presented no paths free of regrets, and her Mercurian alliance was a choice she would again make.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It will not be too much longer, Tuatha," she said to the monk who had been her shadow in the years of the war of Tempus Mor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, my liege, there have been many fewer injured of our forces in the last months. And even fewer of the enemy killed or injured. Reports from Decius have been positive on his front as well, and the Ljosalfar refugees are eager to return."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne nodded. "This war may draw to an end soon, and we can tend to the people and land so harmed in it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have done enough." The voice came out of nowhere.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is a restricted area. If you have grievances-"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You cannot restrict us." This time the voice was from the other side of them. Ethne and Tuatha backed towards the hall. Other monks rose from tending the wounded and came to aid Ethne.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was to no avail. She backed into a cloaked man and before she had a chance to turn and see him his blade protruded from her chest. Tuatha grabbed the invader and threw him against the stone wall, then readied his mace and rushed towards him, but the assassin rolled past and into the hall, dashing away. When Ethne's protectors chased after, they found nothing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tuatha called for the castle arch-mage, but knew it would be to no use. He felt the theft of Ethne's spirit-resurrection would be no use.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We must contact Decius. There may be other targets."

Decius directed his army to set up his camp on the foothills of Tempus Mor. The war had been long, and had hardened the Malakim recruits he led, but they stayed true to the Empyrean ideals, and had spared some remnant of his allies' civilizations. The eternal feud between Basium and the Infernals was sure to spread like fire to the rest of the world, as reports came in of Hellfire gates opening in distant lands through the actions of Sheaim agents.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But Tempus Mor would have peace, and Varn's vision of an alliance of the good nations had borne fruit. Decius set a guard and headed into his tent to plot his next action. After some time he fell asleep on the ground beside his maps.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Late into the night he was awoken by a shout from his guard. As he rose he saw, from nowhere, an assassin's arm, dagger readied. Battle-hardened reflexes saved Decius's life, and he disarmed the assassin only to watch him begin to fade from view again. Whether this was some demon or wizard, Decius knew he had better find out who sent him. He grabbed a torch and swung it at the intruder to disrupt his spell. The assassin, a human man cloaked in grey, fell to the ground screaming and Decius's guards were able to subdue him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Interrogation revealed an iron will in the assassin, but he was able to rule out the Svartalfar, Infernals, and Calabim as a source. As he mulled over how to get a motive out of his would-be killer, a messenger arrived. An Elohim monk with word that Ethne the White had succumbed to a similar strike, and magic was useless to revive her. If the Elohim ruler was to be restored, her assailant must be tracked down. And ignoring this threat would surely lead to future attempts, which might pierce his defenses. He had hoped to reinforce a city called Bourne the Gleaming, founded by Empyrean missionaries sent shortly after the first council in the desert of Myrh. But this mission south, into the wastes, took priority. With the secrets of the Mercurian Gate that Ethne had given them, they may be able to hold out against the Infernals summoned from the Hell-fire in lands of Os-Gabella's Sheaim ally, Tebryn.

Os-Gabella stalked alone, appraising the hellish landscape that greeted their progress here. This was once a forest, perhaps even an elven town, though little remained to suggest it. She stooped down and picked up a skull, then let it drop from her fingers. The Infernals' handiwork. There was a certain beauty to the emptiness that made her wistful. Her plan was a long-term one, and while she was well suited for patience, she longed for rest. "So far to go..." she muttered, dropping the skull.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You've gone far enough." Os-Gabella whirled to see the speaker, a cloaked human man with a blade already poised to strike. She did not try to stop him. The strange hunter feinted and spun, impaling her heart in the blink of an eye."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Alas. I hadn't expected you would succeed." She grasped his head and began chanting. A moment later his body fell to the charred field, his head residing in a separate plane altogether.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When Os-Gabella returned to Galveholm, the captain of her spies was waiting for her. "Interesting news, milady. Ethne the White of the Elohim has been slain."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Death is ubiquitous, or so I'm told."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Her archmages were unable to resurrect her. Apparently her assassin has a blade which could send her soul straight to the next world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Os-Gabella inhaled sharply. "Contact Decius. Offer him whatever he names if he retrieves this sword. Meanwhile, the chaos spreads. Already Infernal forces are coming to aid our Arch-mage ally Tebryn. They will surely defeat the Empyrean stronghold of Bourne the Gleaming, as is has been riddled from within by corruption. And all across Erebus, our war will spill. Come, end of all things. Bring me release."
Description: New alliances ignite a religious war in the mountains of Tempus Mor. [NEWLINE]Special Rules: Defeat at least 3 players of opposing alignment.[NEWLINE]Requires: Into the Desert.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Vernichtet die Grey".

TEXT.English: Destroy %d1 more enemy players

Decius was waiting impatiently for the Emissary from the Ashen Veil to discuss strategy. Ritualists still made him uneasy. "Hello, Decius."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius turned. There was a horseman greeting the Calabim leader that he did not recognize, until he removed his helm. "Rosier. You survived, then? I had thought the Order's hounds would have found you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The fallen Oath-taker dismounted. "You'd be surprised what you can survive when you lose all limits. Or perhaps you wouldn't." Rosier laughed. Decius didn't. Rosier continued, "Once we defeat the Overcouncil, the Ashen Veil should have enough strength to challenge even the Bannor."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I thought the Ashen Veil cared more for the slow corruption method?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Once we get the power we need, we can carry the torch to our enemies more openly. The Bannor are a dry husk of hypocrisy ready to be set ablaze. Can we count on your support when that battle comes?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I think you get ahead of yourself. The Mercurians are a mortal threat to you unless we cripple them here and to the West, where they try to build a second gate with the help of the Radiant Guard. Should we prevail... I do not consider the Bannor worth mercy. I was betrayed. But I don't consider revenge my goal, Rosier, nor destruction. If your plans strengthen me, I will be there."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rosier nodded, and their talk turned to strategy.
